title: Senior Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
 We are a forward-thinking team creating cutting-edge, cloud-based communication solutions. Our backend systems leverage the latest C# and .NET Core technologies, deployed in Kubernetes on AWS. We thrive on collaboration, innovation, and crafting scalable, reliable systems that power seamless communication worldwide.
   

  

 If you're a Senior Backend Engineer with a passion for problem-solving, clean code, and modern DevOps practices, we'd love to have you on our team.
   

  

**Role**
 As a Senior Backend Engineer, you'll take ownership of developing and maintaining high-performing backend systems while contributing to all stages of the software lifecycle. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Develop scalable and resilient distributed systems using C# and .NET Core.
* Work closely with engineers, DevOps specialists, and product managers in an agile, cross-functional team.
* Build and maintain applications running on Kubernetes, actively monitor production systems, and ensure reliability.
* Leverage AWS tools and services to deploy, optimize, and scale cloud-based systems.
* Write clean, testable, and maintainable code, with a focus on system performance and scalability.
* Enhance automation, streamline CI/CD pipelines, and troubleshoot issues proactively.
* Influence architectural decisions and actively contribute to enhancing our development and operational practices.


**Requirements**
* Major professional experience building and maintaining backend systems in production.
* Expertise in C#, .NET Core, and developing distributed systems.
* Solid understanding of DevOps principles and experience with CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
* A passion for clean, testable code and modern software practices.


**Good to have**
* Service-oriented architecture and microservices.
* Relational and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, MSSQL, Redis).
* Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and AWS.
* Incident response and on-call rotations.
* Proficiency in additional programming languages such as C++, Python, or Kotlin
* Experience with Asterisk and VoIP protocols, preferably SIP.


 Embrace the challenge and join us!
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: . No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Software Engineer
description:
**👨‍💻 Software Engineer (Java)** 




**💰 65,000 - 80,000 SEK** 




**📍 Stockholm**

description:
**Senior Backend Engineer | Permanent | Hybrid | Stockholm** 




  





 For our client, a SaaS company from Stockholm, we are currently looking for a senior backend developer with ambitions to lead a team.
 



  





 Do you love building well tested and stable applications?
 



 Do you believe that “teamwork makes the dream work”?
 



 As a Developer you can lead the charge and are no stranger to helping others around you?
 



  





 Then this opportunity might be for you!
 



  





**Your Impact** 




 You will be working tightly with both frontend and backend developers on the API and core functionalities, as well as building out the backbone of the platform, which is written in Ruby on Rails. You will challenge the current architecture, deploy improvements it and to the overall processes and systems. You will help coach the development team on best practices and help them grow along with the company. The goal is to have a well-tested and well-architected platform to build on for years to come and this role will have a large impact on how they can best accomplish this.
 



  




* **Lead with Innovation:** 
 Design, develop, and implement improvements that will be the foundation of the platform for years to come.
* **Mentor and Inspire:** 
 Guide and coach fellow developers, sharing your expertise to elevate the entire team’s skills and best practices.
* **Drive Quality:** 
 Ensure that the platform is not only well-tested and stable but also ready to support ambitious growth plans.



  





 Your contributions will have a lasting impact on the platform’s success, helping them to deliver world-class solutions to their clients.
 



  





**What you need** 



* +5 yrs of Ruby on Rails
* +1 yr of Node.JS exp.
* Exp. maintaining and improving upon large code bases
* Exp. working with / writing test suites
* Experience with Postgres and optimizing it



  





**Nice-to-haves** 



* React exp.
* GraphQL exp.
* AWS exp.



  





**What they offer** 



* A fast-growing startup culture on an ambitious mission to digitalize businesses world-wide

* Competitive compensation package
* Centrally located office in Stockholm
* Six weeks of paid vacation
* Pension at ITP1 levels

* Private healthcare insurance

**Ready to Make an Impact? Apply Now!** 




 We’re conducting interviews on a rolling basis, so don’t wait to apply.

title: Software Developer | C#
description:
**Job Description**
**C# | Software Developer Engineer**
**Are you a software developer with strong problem-solving skills and a passion for automation and production systems? Join Coherent's innovative team in Järfälla, where you’ll play a key role in optimizing and automating production processes.**
**About Coherent**
 Coherent is part of the global technology leader Coherent Corp, a pioneer in optoelectronics innovation. With a presence in 73 locations across 18 countries, Coherent specializes in developing cutting-edge, high-quality optoelectronic products that drive technological progress from materials to systems. Our expertise supports the growing demand for world-class components across diverse industries.
   

  

 At our
 **semiconducting, opto-electronic chip factory in Järfälla** 
 , we design and manufacture advanced chips that power next-generation technologies. Our multicultural team of approximately 280 employees includes operators, technicians, and engineers in process, development, and software. We are committed to our core values:
 **Integrity, Collaboration, Accountability, Respect, and Enthusiasm (I CARE)** 
 , which are central to everything we do.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Software Developer, you will drive production efficiency by enhancing automation and developing support systems for our Järfälla factory. This role involves system design, programming, and testing, working in close collaboration with colleagues and stakeholders to deliver innovative solutions.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Develop and maintain Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES) and other planning tools.
* Enhance and maintain production automation systems.
* Manage test and measurement system infrastructure.
* Automate data handling and analysis tools.
* Design and maintain databases (e.g., Microsoft SQL and Raven document database).
* Collaborate with customers, LIMS administrators, and other stakeholders to ensure system alignment.


**Qualifications And Experience**
* A degree in Computer Science, Engineering Physics, or a related field.
* At least 5 years of experience in a relevant role.
* Proficiency in C# programming within the .NET stack.
* Strong knowledge of SQL databases.
* Professional proficiency in English, both written and spoken. Plus to speak and communicate in Swedish.


 You are outgoing, collaborative, and possess excellent communication skills. Your curiosity and solution-oriented mindset enable you to effectively tackle challenges, while your ability to see the bigger picture and take initiative makes you an invaluable team member.
   

  

**Practical Details**
* Start Date: As agreed
* Location: Järfälla


**Union Representatives**
* Jessica Carlsson (Akademikerföreningen, Sveriges Ingenjörer): jessica.carlsson@coherent.com
* Niklas Jansson (Unionenklubben): niklas.jansson@coherent.com


**About Us**
 Coherent is a global leader in lasers, engineered materials and networking components. We are a vertically integrated manufacturing company that develops innovative products for diversified applications in the industrial, optical communications, military, life sciences, semiconductor equipment, and consumer markets. Coherent provides a comprehensive career development platform within an environment that challenges employees to perform at their best, while rewarding excellence and hard-work through a competitive compensation program. It's an exciting opportunity to work for a company that offers stability, longevity and growth. Come Join Us!
   

  

**Note to recruiters and employment agencies:** 
 We will not pay for unsolicited resumes from recruiters and employment agencies unless we have a signed agreement and have required assistance, in writing, for a specific opening.

title: Android Developer
company_industry: Financial Services and Technology, Information and Media
description:
We are seeking experienced Android developers to contribute to the development of cutting-edge mobile applications within the electric vehicle (EV) charging and payment services sector.
 



 We offer a technically challenging role in an international environment, where your work will directly impact the transition from fossil fuels to electrification, supporting the global green energy movement.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 As an Android Developer, you will design, develop, and maintain high-quality Android applications that integrate with our advanced EV charging infrastructure and payment solutions. You will work at the intersection of software and the Internet of Things (IoT), collaborating closely with hardware systems such as EV chargers, payment terminals, and access control devices.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop, test, and maintain Android applications for EV charging and payment services.
* Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, and backend developers to deliver seamless user experiences.
* Ensure application performance, security, and scalability across different platforms and devices.
* Implement integrations with hardware components such as IoT-enabled EV chargers and payment terminals.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest Android development trends and best practices.
* Participate in code reviews and contribute to process improvements.
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues.



  





**Required Qualifications:** 



* Proven experience in Android development using Kotlin and Java.
* Experience with RESTful APIs and third-party libraries.
* Familiarity with IoT concepts and hardware integration within mobile applications.
* Proficiency in version control tools such as Git.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Fluency in Swedish and English.



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* Experience in the electric mobility or fintech industries.
* Knowledge of security protocols and data encryption methods.
* Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines for Android applications.



  





**Why Join Us?** 



* Work with an innovative team at the forefront of the green energy transition.
* Contribute to international projects with significant environmental impact.
* A dynamic workplace that encourages professional growth.
* Competitive salary and benefits.
* Flexible work arrangements, including remote work options.

title: AI Developer for generative code models
description:
Artificial intelligence is transforming society. AI Sweden is the national center for applied artificial intelligence and our mission is to accelerate the use of AI for the benefit of our society, our competitiveness, and for everyone living in Sweden. We drive impactful initiatives in areas such as healthcare, energy, and the public sector while pushing the boundaries of AI research and innovation in fields such as natural language processing and edge learning. Join us in harnessing the untapped value of AI to drive innovation and create sustainable value for Sweden.
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **AI developer for a project on generative code models in our NLU team** 
 .
   

  

**About The Position**
 AI Sweden is part of a project on developing generative code models for the automotive industry. The project will investigate the intersection between generative code models and formal code verification techniques, and we aim to develop a novel type of verification-driven generative code model.
   

  

 In the role as an AI developer, you will focus on generative code models based on the Transformer architecture. You will work in Sweden’s leading research group on Large Language Models (the NLU group at AI Sweden), and you will encounter a range of stimulating technical challenges and develop some of the most sought-after technical skills in the industry. You’ll be working in a highly stimulating environment where your creativity and power of initiative is not just welcomed, but essential. This position is perfect for those who want to apply their programming skills and inventiveness to cutting-edge development of Transformer-based code models.
   

  

 We encourage female applicants, and we aim to fill the position as soon as possible.
   

  

 We believe that as a person you’re
   

  

**Inquisitive Learner:** 
 Passionate about AI and machine learning, you are driven by a desire to continually learn and stay on top of the latest developments.
   

  

**Practical Problem Solver:** 
 With a talent for innovative solutions, you see past challenges and focus on constructive outcomes. Your approach combines practicality with creativity.
   

  

**Effective Communicator:** 
 Your ability to convey complex ideas clearly is important. We highly value a knowledge-sharing culture within our diverse team.
   

  

 And workwise, you are
   

  

**Strong Programmer:** 
 You have excellent and proven programming skills in Python and preferably also C and C++.
   

  

**Practical Deep Learner:** 
 You have previous experience working with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch. HPC experience is a plus.
   

  

**Experienced Transformer:** 
 You have previously worked with Transformer-based models. It’s a plus if you have worked with autoregressive Transformers and code models.
   

  

**Agile Implementer & Tester:** 
 Quick to grasp and understand new machine learning techniques and trends, you'll experiment with cutting-edge techniques alongside our team.
   

  

 Why work for AI Sweden?
   

  

 To us, artificial intelligence is not only about tech, it’s a force for positive societal change. You'll be working alongside leading AI experts, scientists, journalists, linguists, policy professionals, entrepreneurs, change leaders, and many more. To work here, you don’t need to know “everything” about AI, but you need to believe in its potential to help shape our society for the better.
   

  

 As an organization, we’re uniquely positioned at the sweet spot of governmental influence and startup agility. Small enough to stay adaptive and have fun but backed by and in close contact with both the government, academia and private and public sector.
   

  

 Join us to make a real-world impact by contributing to initiatives that benefit society and tackle critical challenges. Be at the forefront of AI innovation, working with cutting-edge technologies and playing a key role in shaping the future of AI in Sweden.
   

  

 And, within our mission, we can most certainly be a platform empowering you to realize your ideas. AI Sweden’s ability to empower partners and individual team members to do exceedingly well in their profession is a key success factor for driving positive and significant impact.
   

  

 In short, we like to believe we offer our team members a place to grow, an environment for personal development.
   

  

 An equal and fair working environment
   

  

 We strongly believe in diversity and inclusion and are acutely aware of the skewed gender balance in our industry. We actively strive to put together a diverse team in terms of age, gender and background.
   

  

 Naturally, we’re under a collective agreement (“kollektivavtal”) and offer everything that comes with it in terms of annual leave, pensions, wellness allowance (“friskvårdsbidrag”), and such.
   

  

**Application Deadline** 
 : we will evaluate candidates continuously.
   

  

 If you have any questions or thoughts, don’t hesitate to contact
 **Magnus Sahlgren, Research Manager, NLU** 
 .
   

  

*AI Sweden does not accept unsolicited support and kindly ask not to be contacted by any advertisement agents, recruitment agencies or manning companies.*

title: Senior Software Engineer - JavaScript
company_industry: Software Development, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Financial Services
description:
**About Us**
 With over 85 million global active users and 2,5 million transactions per day, Klarna is on the way to becoming the world’s favorite way to shop. To help us get there, we’re assembling an unparalleled global talent team—accelerating individual careers, and disrupting entire industries. We’re looking for people ready to achieve the extraordinary and embrace our bold ambitions as we shape the future of payments and fintech. Will you join us?
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Tackle specific problem spaces critical to Klarna’s current needs, with ample growth opportunities in a fast-paced business environment.
* Bring innovative ideas from diverse areas, including information retrieval, large-scale system design, data storage/processing, security, artificial intelligence, UI design, and mobile development.
* Develop your professional skills in an entrepreneurial organization that encourages working with your areas of interest.
* Use state-of-the-art technology to solve real problems for our customers at a massive scale.
* Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software; take full responsibility for the lifecycle of your code.
* Share your knowledge and help the team evolve best practices; act as both a mentor and mentee.
* Work in small, autonomous teams with short release cycles.
* Contribute to open source projects: Klarna GitHub.


**Who You Are**
* Proficient in TypeScript and Node.js.
* Experienced with common JavaScript libraries and frameworks.
* Skilled in React and React Native.
* Knowledgeable in product development, cloud technologies, and microservices.
* Passionate about writing clean and testable code.
* Familiar with Agile practices, including Pairing, TDD, BDD, Continuous Integration, and Continuous Delivery.


**Technologies We Work With**
* JavaScript / TypeScript
* React + React Native with Redux
* Node.js and Express.js
* REST API and GraphQL API
* Kafka
* Internal design system
* AWS, Splunk, Datadog, Jenkins, and Docker


**Closing**
 Please include a CV in English.
   

  

 Since 2005, Klarna has been on a mission to reimagine how consumers spend and save in their daily lives. We help people save time and money and reduce financial worry. With over 85 million global active users and 2.5 million transactions per day, our vision is a world where Klarna empowers everyone, everywhere, through seamless financial and commerce experiences—as a personalized, trusted assistant making financial empowerment effortless.
   

  

 Over 575,000 global retail partners, including H&M, Saks, Sephora, Macys, IKEA, Expedia Group, and Nike have integrated Klarna's innovative technology to deliver a seamless shopping experience online and in-store.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
 Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.
   

  

 Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.
   

  

**About Tzeract**
 Tzeract is a startup of 20+ engineers within Kambi Group, revolutionizing sports betting with AI, advanced analytics and real-time data. Our small, agile team is creating an innovative platform that powers next-generation betting experiences. Supported by Kambi’s global resources, you'll have the chance to contribute to AI projects designed to scale internationally, impacting over 500 million bets annually. Get to know us better at www.tzeract.com.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 At Tzeract, your work will directly shape the future of sports betting, impacting millions of users worldwide! You'll collaborate in small teams of engineers with expertise in quantitative analysis, data, machine learning, and AI. Together, you’ll develop systems that analyze real-time data, delivering personalized experiences to sports fans everywhere. This is your chance to drive meaningful changes while working with the latest technologies.
   

  

 With experience in cloud development and microservices you’ve been involved in high-transaction systems. If you’ve explored Rust or Go, you’ll align well with our future goals. Tzeract is a fast-paced startup, where scope or roadmap can shift to align with future goals. If this excites you, along with the flexibility of a hybrid work setup and a central office location, we’d love to get to know you better.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable microservices using Python & AWS technologies.
* Implement best practices in SWE, including CI/CD, containerization, and automated testing to ensure quality and speed of deployment.
* Collaborate with software and data engineers - as well as scientists to integrate AI models and algorithms into production systems efficiently.
* Contribute to improvements on both technical and operational aspects of our daily work.


**What we believe you have:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (a PhD in Mathematics is a plus).
* 5+ years of software development experience, with the ability to quickly adapt to new technologies.
* Experience with DevOps tools and practices, including Docker, Jenkins, or similar.
* Great at solving problems, you know how to lead projects and bring teams together to achieve great results.


**Kambi's ongoing commitment to Diversity and Inclusion in the workplace**
 If you require any reasonable adjustment during the recruitment process, please notify your recruiter, who will assist you however they can. Diversity and inclusion is at the heart of who we are and who we aim to be. While we are proud of the positive and inclusive company culture we have created, we know we can do so much more. Kambi constantly evolves its Diversity and Inclusion strategy to ensure it becomes an even more inclusive and positive place to work, with the core management team reaffirming its commitment to delivering on employee feedback.
   

  

**Creating an inclusive environment**
 We believe Kambi's greatest strength is the collective talent of our employees. Kambi is committed to ensuring we create an inclusive work environment where everyone can feel valued, thrive and achieve their potential, regardless of who they are or what their background is. We know that it is only by having a balance of different voices, values and opinions that Kambi is able to be the market leader it is today.
   

  

 #wearekambi

title: Applikationsutvecklare till StrongPoint E-Commerce
description:
*Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens butiksteknologi? Hos StrongPoint väntar en roll där du skapar lösningar som gör skillnad och förbättrar shoppingupplevelsen. Nu söker vi dig som brinner för mobilutveckling och vill vara en del av ett kompetent team och en global produkt!*
**Din vardag**
 I rollen som Applikationsutvecklare hos StrongPoint kommer du att ansvara för att utveckla och underhålla mobilapplikationer som används globalt. Ditt fokus ligger på att skapa användarvänliga, robusta och säkra appar med hjälp av C#, .NET, Xamarin.Forms och .NET MAUI. I nära samarbete med utvecklingsteamet som är placerat i Täby och Baltikum jobbar du med att säkerställa kvalitet och användarvänlighet i våra applikationer. Du är med i projekt från start till lansering och bidrar till att förbättra vår produkt inom orderplock för dagligvaruhandeln.
   

  

 Du blir en del av en dynamisk grupp snabbfotade problemlösare som älskar att hålla oss uppdaterade med den senaste tekniken. På StrongPoint värdesätter vi varandras kompetenser och motiverar varandra att ständigt utvecklas. Tillsammans skapar vi en arbetsmiljö präglad av positivitet, nytänkande och engagemang.
   

  

 Rollen är placerad i Täby där delvist distansarbete är möjligt. Du rapporterar till R&D Manager E-com Tech.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig med en stark känsla för kvalitet och en önskan att ständigt utvecklas. Du är en lagspelare med positiv attityd, har ett driv och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad på den senaste tekniken. För att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Ett par års erfarenhet av liknande roller som gett erfarenhet av mobil APP utveckling
* Expertis inom C# och .NET
* Erfarenhet av cross-platform mobilutveckling med Xamarin.Forms och/eller .NET MAUI
* Erfarenhet av distribution och signering för Apple/Google-projekt
* Kunskap inom Azure DevOps och CI/CD-processer
* Förståelse för design- och arkitekturmönster (ex. mediator, MVVM)
* Erfarenhet av att använda RESTful API
* Flytande svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Relevant teknisk utbildning eller motsvarande erfarenhet


**Om oss**
 StrongPoint är ett företag inom butiksteknologi som tillhandahåller lösningar och tjänster för att göra butiker smartare, shoppingupplevelsen bättre och e-handel med mat effektivare. Vi är verksamma i mer än 25 länder på fyra kontinenter. I över 35 år har vi lyssnat på dagligvaruhandlare, förstått deras problem och utvecklat innovativa tekniska lösningar för att hjälpa dem att bli mer produktiva, minska kostnaderna och skapa effektivitetsvinster. Bolaget har huvudkontor i Norge, är mer än 500 anställda och är noterade på Oslobörsen under STRONG. Här kan du läsa mer om oss: https://www.strongpoint.com/se/om-oss/
   

  

**Kontakt**
 I den här rekryteringen samarbetar StrongPoint med Wise IT. Vill du veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Anja Widell på anja.widell@wiseit.se.
   

  

 Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via mail, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet. Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter.
   

  

 Vi hanterar alla ansökningar löpande och även urvalet av kandidater som går vidare till intervju.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Senior Java Software engineer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Vi söker nu en Software engineer inom arkitektur design, AD.
   

  

 Du ska skriva AD och koda (10 ca års erfarenhet).
   

  

 Finns en del legacy, man ska vara van vid komplexa organisationer och finansiell erfarenhet.
   

  

**Tekniker**
 Java, Angular, kotlin, GIT, Microservices.
   

  

 Meriterande med erfarenhet från storbank
   

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 27-01-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: C++ Developer
description:
**Company Overview**
 Metrea is a defense company dedicated to translating commercial innovation into solutions for the hardest problems in national security. With deep mission expertise, Metrea focuses on delivering effects as-a-service across a spectrum of domains including Air & Space, Electromagnetic & Cyber, and Synthetic. Metrea Management provides central services to eleven (11) global capability units via Operations, Solutions, Strategy, Legal, and Finance teams
   

  

**Capability Unit Overview**
 Metrea Simulations (MSIM), redefines the cutting edge of flight simulation and services. Our expertise in physics, engineering and artistry allows us to leverage modern technologies in new and unprecedented ways in order to create the most realistic and immersive flight simulation training products and experiences possible. Through our technologies, customers enjoy an optimal path to efficient training, design, technology development and tactical analysis across the aviation sector. Our technology nucleus of advanced AI, flight and sensor modeling enables us to augment reality through the lens of next-generation products and services.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 Metrea Simulations is looking for experienced C++ programmers to join our team creating our core large scale simulation platform as well as simulation systems for different military aircraft. As a generalist C++ programmer, you will work closely with our experts in aerospace and military simulations to create an immersive simulated world with complex and realistic agent behavior and a rich pattern of life. You will support specialized team members with a variety of programming tasks. If you are looking forward to solving hard technical problems and can delve deep into understanding the underlying codebase while keeping performance in mind, we will be a good match for you.
   

  

 This role will require you to be a team player who enjoys working in a multidisciplinary environment and expects you to be communicative and independent in your work. You should be motivated to find creative and scalable solutions for complex problems.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
 As a generalist C++ programmer, you will develop various systems within our simulation software. We have a broad range of tasks to take on and we will try our best to match your skillset with the items in our backlog. Typically, as a part of a team, you will be responsible for delivering new, or expanding existing systems related to vehicle simulations, that also includes reviewing code from colleagues. The list of skills and experience we look for is quite broad, we don’t expect you to know everything, but we anticipate that you should tick at least a few of those boxes.
   

  

**Skills And Experience**
* Experience with Unreal Engine C++ programming
* Experience with Perforce
* UI/UX design and/or UI programming experience
* Experience from the video game industry
* Passion for anything aerospace-related
* Experience with simulation training tools development
* Experience with large-scale games or simulations
* Experience with wargames
* Experience working with international teams
* Background in related fields (e.g., Military, Aerospace, Software, Engineering, Physics, Math)


**Additional Eligibility Qualifications**
* Engineering degree
* 5+ years of professional C++ programming


**Our Culture**
 Metrea’s single core value, “rooted in humility,” is supported by four key attributes: entrepreneurial, systematic, discerning, and over-deliver. These attributes, combined, form our Teammate Firmware, our culture. We explore these attributes during the hiring process when we grow our teams and continually support the growth of our culture. We are a hyper-collaborative, dynamically hierarchical organization united by a passion for what we do, how we do it, who we do it with, and who we do it for.
   

  

**Right to Work**
 The employee will have the legal right to work in the Sweden / Poland and will be able to produce right to work documentation.
   

  

**Equal Opportunities Statement**
 Metrea Management Limited (MAM) is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work**
 This is a full-time (40hrs/week) position.
   

  

**Work Location**
 Stockholm – Hybrid remote
   

  

**Work Environment** 
 This job operates in an office setting
   

  

**Travel**
 The role will require occasional travels

title: Senior Backend Developer (.NET)
description:
MAJORITY is a groundbreaking all-in-one digital financial service app that includes an FDIC-insured account, Visa® Prepaid card, money remittance, and international calling. We are built for migrants, by migrants.
   

 Global migration is a 21st-century reality. Whether people are following their dreams, love or new experiences, more and more of us are leaning towards new environments. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the amazing, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve all of their ambitions.
   

 We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Our mission is to provide migrants the tools to thrive in their new country.
   

 We are a diverse group of people from over 40 different countries that come together every day and we’re looking for others driven by the same desire to create meaningful products that bridge cultural and geographic distances
   

 MAJORITY is looking for a Senior Backend Engineer (.NET) to join its Engineering team. This is a full time, in-person position based in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

**About MAJORITY Backend**
 We’re a diverse bunch of skilled software developers with a passion for technical excellence. We strive to create innovative solutions to the many varied business problems that we are presented with. We work hard, deliver fast, are continually learning and have fun along the way. With a team of 12 backend developers we have built a system of nearly 60 microservices with a million lines of C# code. Our business is growing fast and therefore so is our need to continually scale the system to meet the growing number or users and transactions.
   

* We have a modern technical platform. Recently upgraded to .Net8.
* We have a microservice architecture, fully in C#. built on a solid foundation of base functionality like observability, DI, messaging etc.
* We have a high pace of development, shipping major new features frequently.
* We have leadership who understands and prioritizes technical work.
* We work in a domain (fintech) where correctness matters. We have very high uptime and correctness requirements. No payments should fail, and no cent can be lost!


****Key Responsibilities****
* Design, develop and maintain microservices built with .NET Core
* Write clean code with proper test coverage to support CI/CD workflows
* Contribute in design and architecture decisions within the team and across the organization
* Develop scalable, performant, and reliable systems
* Participate as a team member in agile deliveries
* Identify bugs and bottlenecks and resolve issues efficiently


**Requirements**
* You have 10+ years of experience working with modern backend development practices, with focus on .NET Frameworks and C#.
* You have good experience in cloud environments
* You have good experience working with SQL databases
* You are familiar with working with microservices & event driven architecture
* You have an understanding and interest in building and maintaining microservices running in Kubernetes
* You have experience with build tools and services such as AzureDevops


**About you**
* You're smart and you get stuff done
* You are ambitious, have a positive energy and always find a solution
* You can prioritize speed without neglecting quality and understand that speed is a competitive advantage
* You have a strong sense of ownership and accountability
* You are eager to learn from others and share what you know
* You dare to make decisions and learn from your mistakes
* You can reason through the trade-offs to make correct decisions for the benefit of the organization
* You have great communication skills in English


 Looking to be challenged? To work in an environment where your opinions are welcome and you’re constantly learning? To have a real impact on a meaningful project? To work with the latest technologies and to help shape the technology direction of the organization? Then we’d love to hear from you.
   

 We are MAJORITY. We are international, ambitious, kind, and inclusive. We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Embedded SW Developer within R&D - Stockholm
description:
**Job Description**
**Embedded SW Developer within R&D - Stockholm**
 Are you a skilled embedded software developer or proven tester with a passion, mainly but not exclusively, within the Automotive Industry?
   

  

 Then, join our dynamic team and become a driving force behind cutting-edge automotive technology!
   

  

**Here You Can Find**
* Innovative Projects: Dive into exciting projects at the forefront of Automotive development, shaping the future of mobility.
* Top-Notch Tools: Access the latest tools and technologies, empowering you to excel in your craft.
* Collaborative Environment: Work alongside a talented team of professionals, collaborating seamlessly to conquer challenges and achieve excellence.
* Continuous Growth: Fuel your passion for learning with ongoing training and development opportunities.
* Impactful Work: Make a meaningful impact by contributing to the creation of safe, reliable, and innovative automotive solutions that touch lives globally.


**Your Role As An Embedded Software Developer**
 You will focus on developing embedded software, mainly but not exclusively within the Automotive Industry.
   

  

**Main Responsibilities Can Include The Following Tasks**
* Developing software using C and C++ programming languages.
* Use MATLAB and Simulink for modeling and potentially generate C code.
* Write unit tests or other testcases (Python)
* Working with real-time operating systems (RTOS) and embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.
* Debugging hardware-related programming issues using tools such as JTAG.
* Utilizing version control systems such as Git and CI/CD pipelines.


**Your Profile**
 To be successful in this role, we are looking for an individual who has:
   

  

* At least 5 years of experience with embedded programming in C/C++.
* Experienced in MATLAB and Simulink
* Experience with hardware-related programming and debugging, including JTAG and other debugging tools.
* Knowledge of real-time operating systems (RTOS) and experience with embedded Linux or other embedded operating systems.
* Experience with version control systems such as Git and continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines.
* Excellent writing and verbal English skills
* Bachelor’s or Master degree in relevant field


**Meritorious**
* Experience from Electrical Vehicles
* Experience from Driveline Control Systems
* Experience from Engine Control Modules and Combustion Engines
* Experience from Powertrains
* Understanding of Automotive software development processes, such as Automotive SPICE or ISO 26262.
* Familiarity with Automotive communication protocols such as CAN, LIN, and Ethernet.
* Experience of the consultant role in a European country
* Spoken and written Swedish is meritorious.


**Application and Contact**
 Selection and interviews are running continuously. Apply now to join our team and make a meaningful impact in the automotive industry.
   

  

 For questions and for more information contact Jan Hansson, Talent Acquisition Partner, 0725-616900
   

  

 Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.
   

  

 We kindly but firmly refrain from direct contact with staffing, brokerage, and recruitment companies as well as other external actors and sellers of additional job advertisements.

title: Full Stack Developer & Startup Founder (March 2025)
job_function: Information Technology, Business Development, and Strategy/Planning
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
**Note: This Opportunity Does Not Offer Employment, but rather an opportunity to build your own VC-backed startup!** 




  





**Who you are:** 




 You are a highly accomplished full-stack software developer with a demonstrated ability to deliver innovative solutions. Your exceptional programming skills and experience in building complex applications position you to tackle significant challenges within the tech industry. You possess a strong problem-solving aptitude and a passion for pioneering cutting-edge technologies. Driven to make a real impact, you're eager to leverage your expertise in building disruptive tech ventures.
 



  





**About Antler** 




 Antler is the world's most active venture capital firm, providing funding from pre-seed to Series C. We invest in Founders who seek to define our tomorrow and reshape the world we live in with groundbreaking technological innovation. Every year, we handpick the strongest Founders from more than 135,000 applicants across our 27 locations on the globe, which has led us to work with more than 7,000 founders to date and a portfolio of more than 1,000 startups.
 



  





**The Antler Founder Residency** 




 Join a dynamic cohort of 200+ highly motivated entrepreneurs for an immersive 12-week program. Visit our website for a detailed breakdown of how we'll support your startup launch.
 


* 12-Week full-time Immersive Journey: Kicking off March, 2025, in Stockholm.
* Co-Founder Discovery: In the first 10 weeks, collaborate with fellow Founders to find your co-founder(s).
* Pitch to Invest: Present your team and business idea to the Antler Investment Committee. Secure a net cash investment of EUR 100k for 10% equity.
* Accelerate Growth: If funded, we work closely with you to make your startup a success



  





**Program Details** 



* **Start Date:** 
 March 3rd, 2025
* **Location:** 
 Onsite at our Stockholm office
* **Compensation:** 
 While participants don't receive financial compensation during the program, pre-seed investment is available to jumpstart your venture.
* **Visa Sponsorship:** 
 Due to the non-employment nature of the program, visa sponsorship is unavailable.



  





**For our March 2025 cohort, we’re looking for someone who:** 



* Having the autonomy to develop sophisticated software solutions to address real-world challenges, merging ingenuity with functionality.
* Exceptional problem-solving and analytical skills, capable of breaking down complex issues and bringing structure into business cases
* Providing leadership, whether it’s directing a development team or managing comprehensive product delivery.
* You have an idea that you believe can solve a problem you are deeply interested in. You understand that you need co-pilots who share your vision and values.



  





**Application Process** 




 Our streamlined application process takes only 2-3 weeks:
 


1. Apply through our website.
2. Participate in an introductory interview.
3. Progress to an in-depth interview with our partners.
4. Receive a potential offer.



  





**Antler Success Stories** 




 Several companies built through the Antler program have received pre-seed investment and have gone on to secure significant funding rounds. Here are just a few examples:
 


* **Wingbits:** 
 A community-driven flight data tracking platform
* **Two:** 
 A comprehensive B2B payment suite simplifying sales for online and offline businesses.
* **Evyon:** 
 A developer of eco-friendly battery energy storage systems.
* **Glint Solar:** 
 Software accelerating the identification of optimal solar installation sites.
* **PerPlant:** 
 AI-powered sensor systems creating a gateway to sustainable agriculture.

title: Lead Software COBOL Engineer (Lead developer, Team Architect)
description:
Are you an experienced developer in Mainframe & COBOL, who are looking for new challenges within the interesting & society critical Card Payments Area? If yes, you are the missing piece in our team!In Swedbank you have the opportunity to:
 * Work in the Card Processing unit responsible for the processes of authorization, fraud monitoring and prevention and clearing and settlement within the Card payment area, supporting the Nordic and the Baltic Acquiring and Issuing business.
* Card Processing will during a long period of time be under transformation and here it is crucial for us to have a senior Lead, that can take both tactical and operational approach.
* As a Senior Software Engineer, you will work in a team with extensive knowledge and experience. You will be responsible for development and maintenance of the systems and services enabling the Clearing & Settlement processes for the Card Acquiring and Issuing area.
* Senior level means that you will work with analyse, technical design, architectural solutions, lead programming, mentoring other developers, test development and deployment. In this role we expect you to be a self-leader and that you take a leading position within the team.
* You will have a lot of fun working in our strong and caring team, with both senior and junior team members. We support each other and the important business area that we work in! Our values Open, Simple & Caring guides us in our daily work!


 What is needed in this role:
 * Several years (>10 years) of experience from working with development and maintenance in Mainframe
* Worked as a senior Cobol-developer and have experience from working with Changeman, DB2, SQL, JCL & OPC program
* Worked with requirements, analysis, design and complex programming and test
* IT software architecture experience and system integration is preferable
* Worked with IT support and ITIL tools and processer - Incident, Problem and Change
* Agile way of working and preferable according to SAFe
* Experience from working in the Card Payment Area is an advantage
* A strong team player attitude
* Strong Self-leadership skills – also leading other developers.
* Driven and curious with a learning mindset
* Be proficient in English
* Being proficient in Swedish is also an advantage
* Relevant University degrees or equivalent work experience


 What we offer when you join us:
 * An open, simple and caring culture
* Opportunity to create the best experience for our customers
* An international, sustainable and inclusive work environment
* Development opportunities and advancement in your career
* Flexible working options
* Access to Group performance program, company pension plan, optional health insurance, and other benefits


 "Join our team and...
 
 At Swedbank we believe that people are our core strength. Our culture is built on respect, inclusion, and openness. We support the continuous development and enable you to take the lead in your career and find inspiring challenges. We take care of your well-being by providing a sustainable and flexible working environment. As an employee, you will be part of the Group performance program, offered a company pension plan, optional health insurance, as well as other benefits. We are guided by our values: Open, Simple and Caring. It’s all about delivering a positive and unique experience for our customers through collaboration and teamwork – together we make a difference.
 



**Be a part of our team with…**
 Professional colleagues, who work together to deliver great solutions and functionality to ensure and contribute to Swedbank's position in the card industry."
 **Linn Hjortsberg, your future manager**



 We look forward to receiving your application by 18.02.2025. We work with continuous selection, which means that the position may be filled before the application deadline. 
 
**Location: Stockholm**




**Recruiting manager: Linn Hjortsberg**




 Wemay begin the selection during the application period, so we welcome yourapplication as soon as possible.
   





*We have made our choice regardingrecruitment media and therefore kindly decline contact with ad sellers orsellers of other recruitment services.*
****Swedbank does not discriminate anybody based on gender, age, sexual orientation or sexual identity, ethnicity, religion or disability – everybody is welcome.****

title: Business Developer - Procurement Transformation
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

 Are you attracted by working in a commercial and international environment, have a strategic and forward looking mindset together with a strong understanding and interest in procurement? We are now looking for a business developer to work with transformation and innovation of how we do procurement and who want to be part of Scania's and Tratons work to deliver procurement excellence.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 The main responsibility of the business developer is primarily to spearhead transformation initiatives and challenge our current ways of working. The work will be highly forward looking, setting the prerequisites for excellence in the years to come. The business developer will also support and team up with other specialists and stakeholders to drive continuous improvements of current processes and tools.
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

  

* Process Transformation: Redesign processes to align with new business models, digital tools, and emerging trends. Lead process-related workstreams in procurement change initiatives.
* Digital Enablement: Team up with colleagues to externally identify potential solutions that could enhance procurement processes.
* Innovation: Research and experiment with new tools, frameworks, and methodologies.
* Future-State Design: Create target operating models that incorporate cutting-edge technologies and methodologies.
* Strategic Alignment: Collaborate with senior leaders and stakeholders to align process transformation initiatives with organizational strategy.
* Program Involvement: Oversee and contribute in process related workstreams in complex projects, ensuring their overall success.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Engage with diverse stakeholders to drive buy-in for transformation efforts.


**Who You Are**
 We are looking for someone with previous experience in business- & process transformation and preferably within one or several procurement areas. To be successful in this role, you need to be excellent at stakeholder collaboration and communication, have a keen interest in research and in the future of procurement excellence and have the ability to drive long-term change in a successful way. You enjoy taking initiative and develop the role you are in. As a person, you are positive and contribute to good team spirit in the groups you work in, especially in times when the pace of work is high.
   

  

 As the role involves work at an international level as well as some traveling, an advanced level of English, both in writing and verbally, is mandatory, and good knowledge of Swedish is an advantage.
   

  

**This is Us**
 We are a diverse team of nine individuals from different backgrounds, mixed ages, genders and nationalities. We all have our own areas of responsibilities within different procurement capabilities, but still collaborate and share workload to an extent, supporting each other and sharing experiences to find the best solutions and drive excellence within our team and department. We work together to create a climate where skills, as well as opinions, are openly shared and respected, while striving to have fun at work.
   

  

 The team is based at Scania's procurement office in Södertälje and we are employing a hybrid work set-up, meaning that you have the opportunity to work from home or in our office in central Stockholm some days of the week.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-02-03. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Daniel Ahlquist, Head of Procurement Processes & Methods, at daniel.ahlquist@scania.com

title: Site Verification Developer
description:
As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we’ve made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead, and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology.
   

  

 Join our Team
   

  

**About this opportunity:**
 The Product Engineering Group (PEG) Site Solutions develops and maintains Ericsson Radio Site Solutions. Our responsibilities include enclosure systems, site power and energy systems, integrated site build solutions, installation and inter-connect solutions, smart site monitoring and management solutions. We seek new technologies and partners in the site area through vendor scouting, pre-development, and technology studies. Site Solutions collaborates globally to create holistic site solutions. Site Integrations (SI) provides expertise in HW-SW integration, including test management and verification during design and development.
   

  

 We are now looking for an Integration/Verification Developer within the Site Solution area, including power, battery back-up systems, controllers, enclosures, sensors, and other site equipment’s for our Radio Base sites! Your role will include I&V activities such as: writing verification specifications and test reports, integrate and verify site solutions, fault handling and TR writing, write scripts in Linux environment and develop tools.
   

  

**You will:**
* Integrate, verify, test and evaluate Site solutions
* Perform trouble shooting both for Hardware and Software
* Handle tools development
* Run continuous improvements of products and processes
* Create test scripts
* Develop competence in technical domain


**You will bring:**
* Some experience in programing in any of following: Python, Java, C, C++
* Some experience in integration and verification
* Some experience to deliver results and meeting customer expectations
* Interest in trouble shooting and customer support
* Interest in networking
* Interest in Software, Hardware, and System Development
* Interest to take on more opportunities to grow
* Technical drive with willingness to learn
* Interest in innovating, adapting, and responding to change


**Why join Ericsson?**
 At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Req ID:** 
 760494
   

  

 ]]>

title: Software Engineer - Python/Golang - Kubernetes
description:
As a member of the Kubernetes product team, you will build the operators and addons; the former, offering complete lifecycle management of mission-critical components, and the latter, a zero-ops experience for seamlessly integrating projects into your Kubernetes.
   

  

 You will gain familiarity with the latest features in Kubernetes and look to incorporate the best of open-source to bring functionality to our end-users. You will collaborate with industry peers and partners to bring the right solutions to our customers.
   

  

 This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Golang, Python and Kubernetes.
   

  

***Location***
 : This is a remote position available in EMEA and the Americas.
   

  

 What you will focus on
   

  

* Write high-quality code to create new features
* Debug issues and interact with a vibrant community
* Collaborate proactively with a distributed team
* Work with helpful and talented engineers including experts in many fields
* Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You are a Golang developer also fluent in Python
* You have experience with Kubernetes
* You have strong written and verbal communication skills
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
* You love technology and working with brilliant people


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Tech Lead Manager
description:
**About Sinch**
 Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch's Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
   

  

 Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
   

  

 At Sinch we "Dream Big", "Win Together", "Keep it simple", and "Make it Happen". These values are our foundation!
   

  

**Description**
**Are you a skilled backend software developer ready to grow into a leadership role while staying hands-on in technology?** 
 Join us as a Tech Lead Manager, where you'll lead an empowered development team delivering scalable components for data optimization, billing, account management, and product configuration tooling.
   

  

 This role offers a perfect blend of leadership and technical contributions, giving you the opportunity to guide a team of developers while actively shaping the technical direction.
   

  

**Responsabilities**
* Define clear goals, coach your team members, and foster a collaborative, growth-oriented environment.
* Work closely with your product partner to plan and build the right solutions at the right time.
* Stay hands-on by contributing to backend development, driving DevOps practices, and supporting code reviews, testing, and quality assurance.
* Manage salaries, performance, and career development for your team members.
* Ensure high-quality, timely delivery of technical solutions that meet business needs.
* Balance people leadership with strong technical contributions, making yourself a go-to resource for the team.


**Requirements**
* Strong experience in backend development such as .NET or Java technologies.
* Hands-on knowledge of DevOps practices, including CI/CD and infrastructure as code, and Kubernetes.
* Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud
* Experience with code reviews, testing, and ensuring software quality.
* Proven leadership experience or a strong desire to grow into a management role.
* Excellent communication skills in English, with the ability to align stakeholders.
* A collaborative, goal-oriented mindset with the ability to inspire and support your team.


 Embrace the challenge and join us!
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
   

  

 We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!

title: Senior Java Backend Developer
description:
**The role:**
 You will be part of a cross-functional team of talented developers working together to create the best Sports Betting experience in the world. We are looking for a backend developer to join us!
   

  

 Responsibilities as a backend developer in our team include developing micro services that serve our frontend with sports data, integrating 3rd party components and providing API's, to build up the entire sports betting experience. The data follows the customer's path, from checking the odds, placing a bet, and cashing out. We are a cross-functional team, so working closely with, for example, frontend and native developers and UX is a natural part of the work. A developer in our team participates all aspects of the work, from initial planning and setting up component architecture to maintaining our components and handling issues.
   

  

 Your expertise lies within Java development but there will be opportunities to technically support your colleagues on other technical domains as well. You will be eager to take ownership and develop reliable high-quality code. Occasional travel may be needed as our domain is spread across multiple locations with backend developers not only in Stockholm.
   

  

**We like to use:**
* Java
* Micro Services with SpringBoot
* Kafka/Solace Queue/RabbitMQ or similar
* Restful API's and socket-based API's
* Relational databases
* Docker and Kubernetes
* Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
* Best development practices
* Agile and lean values


**Your experience:**
* You have at least 5 years of experience working as a developer.
* You find the description of this role exciting and want to build scalable software in a distributed architecture, and above all are passionate about solving challenging problems in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment.
* You are a positive person by nature and have a passion for what you do, putting teamwork and collaboration above all else.
* You take great pride in your ability to grasp complex business scenarios and translate them into solutions with clean and performant code.
* You believe in yourself and your own abilities, but also appreciate that there is an endless ocean of new things to learn and take on board, cherishing the opportunity to do so.
