title: User Researcher
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
  
We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a User Researcherin our Stockholmoffice –are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
  
The Role
  
In this role, you will be responsible for driving the user-centred design research within the Product Area: Retention. Theproduct area consists of four teams with established missions that contribute to increased customer satisfaction and lifetime within the customer segments and sports area.Your responsibilities will include conducting diverse user research initiatives to inform both strategic and tactical product decisions.You will collaborate closely with a Product Analyst to combine quantitative and qualitative data into meaningful and actionable insights.
  
  

**Some of your responsibilities will include:**  

Plan and conduct user experience research throughout the design process, from generative to evaluative studies
  
Analyze and synthesize research results to generate insights that influence the development of our products and services
  
Communicate customer insights to teams and stakeholders through the best suitable format, such as personas, customer journeys, workshops, and reports
  
Inspire and coach cross-functional teams in conducting their own research
  
Utilize both data-driven and user-driven insights to drive product decisions
  
Facilitate user research across multiple platforms, including iOS, Android, web, and big screens
  
Work closely with development teams, Product Managers, Researchers, Product Analysts, and Designers to maximize customer value and enhance research operations
  
What we’re looking for
  
We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
  
You have solid experience working with mixed methods, are passionate about customers’ needs, and have a strong understanding of the product development process and the value of working in a data- and insight-driven manner
  
We believe you have a wide toolkit of qualitative research methods that you can decisively apply depending on the problem space at hand
  
Previous experience working together with cross-functional product teams and understanding the iterative processes to continuously improve the experience for users
  
Experience with leading user research projects for products on multiple platforms, and with a good understanding of best practices and UX guidelines (such as iOS, Android, web, and big screens)
  
You are a great communicator who can advocate for users and their needs within the organization. You are self-organized and proactive as a person and don’t mind finding ways to reach your goals
  
Has an educational background in psychology, anthropology, sociology, human-computer interaction, or a deep experience in conducting user research in product organizations
  
What we offer you We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year,an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
  
Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives includingwellness allowance.
  
A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
  
An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
  
Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product –including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.
  
Hit play today
  
If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here –you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position. Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Senior product designer
description:
A share register represents the core of corporate governance, the ownership, current and with all history attached. Yet the most common way of keeping a share register is manually, either analogy with pen & paper or digitally in excel or word. As you can imagine mistakes are made and therefore time spent on administration is way out proportion limiting the usage of the underlying data.
  
A digital tool fully committed to keeping and automating shares and derivatives represents tremendous opportunity as a service for this very purpose but also by facilitating and administrating trade in an exploding private market.
  
Reguity is a fintech company with the leading share register software in Sweden with around 20 000 companies using our service and growing. We are now ready to take the next step on our journey to fully utilize the value for both investors and companies. We are on a mission to make it easier, safer, and more accessible to invest in private companies.
  
Have we captured your interest so far? Great, join our Gothenburg based team as a Senior Product Designer and help us grow from a very solid foundation and take the next step together!
  
  

**What you will do:**  

Identify user pain points and solve problems end-to-end, from initial concepts to release.
  
Share your ideas at varying stages of fidelity, gathering feedback to ensure alignment and elevate the quality of your designs.
  
Create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity designs to tackle challenging UX problems with simple and elegant solutions.
  
Design high-quality interactions with great attetion to visual details.
  
Partner daily with cross functional teams including product, engineering, QA and business to to transform ideas into tangible solutions.
  
Collaborate closely with engineering as they build and ship ideas.
  
Ship, measure, and improve solutions based on quantitative and qualitative feedback and data insights.
  
Expand and maintain our design system to ensure consistency of across the platform feels cohesive and intentional.
  
Document design processes and workflows
  
  

**Who you are:**  

A creative problem solver
  
A team player who enjoys joint success
  
Ambitous, easy going and have a positive attitude
  
A good communicator
  
Understands the principles of usability, accessibility, and responsive design.
  
Enjoys working collaboratively in cross-functional teams,.
  
Has a curious mindset and thrives in a fast-evolving environment.
  
You welcome constructive input, seeing it as an opportunity to grow
  
  

**Prefered qualification and skills:**  

5 + years of Production Design experience in a product setting
  
Experience in fintech, SaaS, or B2B products
  
A systems-thinking mindset, able to understand how individual design decisions fit into the broader product ecosystem.
  
Strong problem-solving skills, balancing user needs with technical constraints and business goals.
  
Experience working closely with cross-functional teams, including Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Research.
  
Comfort navigating feedback loops and iterating based on constructive input.
  
Proficiency in creating user-centric designs that are both functional and visually compelling.
  
Ability to design end-to-end user experiences, from initial research to high-fidelity mockups and prototypes.
  
Fluency in industry-standard design tools like Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, and prototyping tools such as Framer or InVision.
  
  

Additional Qualities
  
Familiarity with analytics tools to evaluate the impact of design decisions on user behavior.
  
  

**Toolbox:**  

Webflow
  
Figma
  
Google analytics
  
Quicksight
  
Intercom
  
Mailchimp

title: Junior UX Designer
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.

 **Jobbeskrivning**  

Vi söker en UX-designer som på ett självständigt sätt kan driva hela UX-processen från att sätta effektmål till att samla behov från verksamhet och användare, designa interaktiva flöden i webb och app, supporta utvecklare, samt följa upp effektmålen.
  

Du ska kunna använda vårt designsystem när så är lämpligt, och samtidigt driva på förbättringar av detsamma när det krävs för att uppnå önskade effekter.  

  

Som designer är det centralt att kunna etablera ett nära samarbete och jobba proaktivt med stakeholders, såväl som designkollegor och utvecklingsteam. Du behöver trivas att jobba enligt våra värdeord Öppen, Enkel, Omtänksam, samt våra ledarskapsprinciper Inspirera, Bygga förtroende och Visa mod.  

  

Erfarenhet av att designa för Bank och Försäkring, gärna personförsäkringar, är meriterande. Även erfarenhet av att jobba med design av interna stödsystem för handläggare/kundtjänst är meriterande. (Vi arbetar i Mac med Figma)  

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**  

* Figma
* minst 3 års erfarenhet

  

**Meriterande**  

* Bank och försäkring
* Design av interna stödsystem för handläggare/kundtjänst

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 28-01-2025 **Om Deploja**  

  

Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.  

  

Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?

  

Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!

 **Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**


Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.


En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.


Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.


Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.


Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?


Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.

  

Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.


Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?

 *Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.*

title: Senior UX-writer
description:
**Om rollen:**  

Du formulerar storslagna ord med två tydliga saker i bakhuvudet: användbarhet och varumärkesupplevelse. Dina strategier och ord gör att användaren kan uppnå sina mål samtidigt som du får varumärket att glittra.
  

  

Du kliver upp på morgonen för att lösa svåra problem och skapa stora förbättringar. Din expertis och erfarenhet gör att du automatiskt tar stort ansvar över användaren, uppdragsgivaren och världen. Nu vill du arbeta med några av de mest utmanande uppdragen du kan tänka dig – som finns hos oss på Knowit Experience.

**Du kommer att:**


* **Helhetsansvar för UX-copy**: Skapa och optimera UX-copy för digitala plattformar, från koncept till leverans.
* **Innehållsstrategi och struktur**: Utveckla innehållsstrategier och informationsstruktur som stöder användarflöden.
* **Workshopledning och konceptutveckling**: Leda workshops och kreativa processer för att utveckla innehåll och digitala strategier.
* **Tonalitet och varumärkesanpassning**: Anpassa språk och tonalitet efter varumärkesröst och målgrupp.
* **Samarbete med team**: Arbeta nära designers, utvecklare och andra intressenter för en enhetlig användarupplevelse.
* **Data-driven iteration**: Använda insikter och data för att iterera och förbättra textbaserade lösningar.

  

**Vi söker dig som har:**

* + Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom UX copywriting, med specialisering inom UX writing, innehållsstrategi och informationsstruktur.
	+ Stor vana av att driva innehållsprojekt framåt, ensam med uppdragsgivaren eller tillsammans med övrigt team.
	+ Erfarenhet av att leda workshops, konceptutveckling, kreativa processer och digitala strategier.
	+ Förmåga att anpassa tonalitet och språk efter varumärkesröst och målgrupp.
	+ Vana att samarbeta med designers, utvecklare och andra intressenter för att säkerställa en enhetlig och engagerande användarupplevelse.
	+ Erfarenhet av att använda data och användarinsikter för att iterera och förbättra textbaserade lösningar.
	
	Har tidigare konsulterfarenhet.  
	+

**Varför Knowit Experience?**


Hos oss är medarbetaren i centrum. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och kreativ miljö där din utveckling står i fokus. Du kommer få möjlighet att arbeta med många spännande kunder och projekt, samtidigt som vi värdesätter balansen mellan arbete och privatliv. Vi tror på en kultur av samarbete, öppenhet och ständig förbättring. Din röst spelar roll, och vi uppmuntrar dig att bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.

**Ansökan**


Låter detta som du? Då vill vi gärna höra från dig! Har du frågor om rollen eller om oss på Knowit? Tveka inte att kontakta Sandra Skilberg.


Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!

title: UI Designer / Scripter contract with possibility to...
description:
Are you a gamer who loves crafting intuitive, visually striking UIs for epic adventures?


Join this team as they finalize their upcoming, groundbreaking title in the MOBA/MMO genre.


Start with a 6-month contract and seize the opportunity to transition into a permanent role if you like what you see!

**Game Boost**
--------------

### **Enabling Smooth Game Productions!**

We provide remote-friendly studios with stellar, game developers in all crafts.

 *Feel free to check us out on* *LinkedIn*

 **Mission brief:**


Collaborate closely with programmer and UI artist in a dynamic, iterative process where designs may evolve quickly to bring UI concepts to life.


Examples of things you will be working on include nameplates, damage meters, ability cooldowns and cast bars.

**UX Design**: Act as the bridge between Game Design and UI Art, collaborating to create functional and visually appealing screens, menus, and widgets through iterative design.

 **UI Scripting**: Take finalized designs from tools like Illustrator and Figma and implement them in the game. You’ll have plenty of support from the teams UI Scripter and UI Programmer to bring these designs to life.

**Details:**

* Start date: January/February
* Duration: 6 months with possibility to transition into full time employment
* Occupancy rate: 100% assignment (Full-time)
* Level: Experienced
* Work set-up: Hybrid in Stockholm

 **Your player profile:**

* Professional experience in UI design, especially for ARPGs, MOBAs, or MMOs.
* Strong understanding of gameplay mechanics and how UI supports the player journey.
* Familiarity with Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, and Unreal Engine for UI development.
* An eye for aesthetics and the ability to balance clarity with visual appeal.
* A proactive and adaptable team player who thrives in an environment of rapid change and iteration.
* Passion for gaming and understanding of how intuitive UI impacts player experience.

 **Traits:**

  

We believe that being humble, collaborative, and open-minded will take you a long way and is the right way to go. It's a good foundation, even if we do understand that you possess a lot more personal attributes in addition.

 ***Note:***


We believe that the world of gaming *can* and *should* include everyone.

*Neither Game Boost, nor our clients tolerate toxic, intolerant behavior* ️

**How to Play!**


It's quick and simple since we aim for low manual data entry!


This means that you can use your LinkedIn or upload a profile of your liking.


Fill in a couple of choice questions that will help us get to know you, your skills, and also understand the basics, like when you're available, location, etc.


Yeah, that's it.


Buzz: Game Project, Assignment, Gig, Creator, Developer, Contractor, Freelancer, Self-employed, Consultant, Work-For-Hire, Co-Development, Programmer, Scripter, Software Engineer, Backend, Frontend, Fullstack, Unreal Developer, C++, UE4, UE5, Unity, Frostbite, Snowflake, Maya, Blender, Computer Games, Mobile Games, Careers in gaming, hitmarker, game jobs, remote game jobs, Google jobs

title: Senior UX och tjänstedesigner
description:
**Om rollen**


För att trivas i rollen som senior UX och tjänstedesigner söker vi dig som är nyfiken och gillar att arbeta brett inom tjänstedesign, hela vägen från research till lösningsförslag och förändringsarbete. Du har erfarenhet från insiktsarbete, research, problemformulering, idégenerering, och att leda workshops. Du är van att växla mellan att arbeta i team och självständigt som expert, och du är en van rådgivare med strategisk höjd som kan bidra till att forma och driva framgångsrika designstrategier.  

  

**Du kommer att:**

* **Helhetsansvar för UX-design**: Arbeta med grafisk design, interaktionsdesign, UX-ritningar från koncept till detaljerad design.
* **Analys och kravutredning**: Identifiera och analysera verksamhetskrav, användarbehov och regelverk som styr designprocessen.
* **Visualisering och detaljerad design**: Skapa och visualisera koncept samt utveckla detaljerade designlösningar som uppfyller användar- och verksamhetskrav.
* **Validering av användarupplevelse**: Genomföra användartester och andra metoder för att säkerställa och förbättra användarupplevelsen.
* **Digital tillgänglighet och inkluderande design**: Säkerställa att designen följer WCAG och främjar inkluderande användarupplevelser.

**Vi söker dig som har:**

* Minst 5 års erfarenhet inom interaktionsdesign och UX design, med beprövad erfarenhet av att arbeta i agila utvecklingsmiljöer.
* Gedigen erfarenhet av att arbeta med hela designkedjan, från konceptdesign till detaljerad design, inklusive validering av användarupplevelse genom användartester eller andra metoder.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av digital tillgänglighet och inkluderande design, med förmåga att säkerställa att designlösningar följer riktlinjerna i WCAG. Det är en bonus om du har certifiering inom området.
* Har tidigare konsulterfarenhet.

**Varför Knowit Experience?**

Hos oss är medarbetaren i centrum. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och kreativ miljö där din utveckling står i fokus. Du kommer få möjlighet att arbeta med många spännande kunder och projekt, samtidigt som vi värdesätter balansen mellan arbete och privatliv. Vi tror på en kultur av samarbete, öppenhet och ständig förbättring. Din röst spelar roll, och vi uppmuntrar dig att bidra till vår gemensamma framgång.


**Ansökan**


Låter detta som du? Då vill vi gärna höra från dig! Har du frågor om rollen eller om oss på Knowit? Tveka inte att kontaktaSandra Skilberg.


Vi ser fram emot att träffa dig!

title: Product Designer
description:
#### **Who we are**


At 55 Degrees, we’re dedicated to helping teams around the world achieve more with less stress. Our applications are used by diverse teams across the globe, from small startups to large enterprises. We believe in delivering exceptional products while maintaining a healthy balance in our lives. Our diverse and inclusive culture fosters collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.


We are now in the exciting position of needing to grow so that we can continue to help organizations reach their goals!

#### **The role**


We are looking for an experienced **Product Designer** to join our team. This role balances both UX and UI responsibilities, focusing on understanding user needs and crafting exceptional designs that improve usability and aesthetics. As a Product Designer, you will lead UX research initiatives, validate design solutions, and create intuitive, production-ready interfaces that bring our product vision to life.


This is an opportunity to join a quickly growing team and make a significant impact from day one. You will report directly to our Co-Founder and Co-CEO focused on product and retention.

##### **Key Responsibilities**

* Conduct user research, including interviews, surveys, and usability testing, to understand user problems and validate potential solutions.
* Analyze user data and feedback to uncover pain points and opportunities for improvement.
* Deliver high-quality designs that are user-friendly, visually appealing, and aligned with the product vision.
* Lead UX validation efforts by conducting A/B testing, analyzing analytics data, and iterating based on insights.
* Work closely with product managers, developers, and stakeholders to define design requirements and ensure seamless implementation.
* Maintain and evolve a design system to ensure consistency across all product interfaces.
* Advocate for user-centric design practices and contribute to the continuous improvement of our design processes.

**Examples of duties include, but are not limited to:**

* Running user interviews to understand customer needs and pain points.
* Building and testing prototypes to validate design solutions.
* Refining user flows to simplify navigation and improve task completion rates.
* Designing intuitive dashboards and data visualization elements.
* Conducting heuristic evaluations to identify usability issues.
* Collaborating with developers to ensure seamless implementation of designs.
* Creating wireframes, user flows, mockups, and interactive prototypes to communicate design concepts.

#### **About you**


To succeed in this role, you must be a creative problem-solver with a strong blend of UX research and UI design skills. You can thrive in a small business and are motivated to contribute to the development of our growing company. We’d love to hear from you if the following describes you:

* Team player with a passion for collaboration and supporting others.
* High standards for quality, with an eye for detail and design excellence.
* Proactive and always looking for opportunities to improve.
* Excited about using user-centered design to create impactful products.

**Your day one qualities:**

* 3+ years of experience designing for SaaS products or similar environments.
* Experience in conducting user research, including interviews, usability testing, and analyzing feedback to validate design solutions.
* A strong portfolio showcasing polished, production-ready UI designs and user-centered solutions.
* Proficiency in design tools like Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD to create wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity mockups.
* Deep understanding of responsive design principles and the ability to design intuitive interfaces for complex workflows.
* Collaborative skills to work effectively with developers, product managers, and stakeholders to implement designs seamlessly.
* Familiarity with Agile development processes and the flexibility to adapt to evolving priorities.
* Fluent English communication skills, with additional languages as a bonus.

**We’ll be excited if you have:**

* Familiarity with component libraries such as MUI (Material-UI), as these are integral to our product design.
* Experience working with front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) to facilitate collaboration with developers.
* Previous experience designing for enterprise or highly technical users.
* Knowledge of data visualization tools and frameworks.
* Basic understanding of accessibility standards and inclusive design principles.
* Experience with A/B testing and data-driven design iterations.
* Familiarity with the Atlassian suite of tools, particularly Jira and Confluence.
* Knowledge of lean/agile methodologies and flow-based practices.

#### **What we offer you**

* Hybrid-remote work
* Flexible hours
* 6 weeks prepaid vacation
* Occupational pension according to ITP plan
* Health insurance
* ‍️ Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK / year
* Bus/train ticket benefit for those who prefer to commute
* Breakfast & Fika - Crackers and fika are always close at hand
* ‍️ Volunteer days - 3 paid days off per year to volunteer for a charity of choice
* Join regular after works and happenings!
* Team spirit - become part of a tight and successful team
* An individual learning & development plan

#### **Apply Now!**

At 55 Degrees, you will learn from a small but amazingly talented group of professionals. You will experience transparency in all aspects of the organization. It is important for us to be happy at work and with our colleagues, and we’re not opposed to having fun after office hours either. All our employees are encouraged to suggest activities and run projects to take us forward on our journey. With 55 Degrees, you will have the opportunity to grow and develop.Join our team and shape the future of 55 Degrees by applying now. We offer a great compensation and benefits package, and the chance to work with dedicated and talented colleagues. Interviews are ongoing, and the position will be filled as soon as we find the perfect match!

##### **What to expect after sending in your application?**

* Our Director of Operations, Michelle, will be your first point of contact and will keep you up to date on the process. Should you have any questions, feel free to reach out to Michelle at michelle@55degrees.se
* During the process, you’ll first have an intro call, and after that, you’ll get to meet the team in two separate discussions.
* Finally, after the discussions, we’ll make you a job offer.
* Welcome to 55 Degrees – we are looking forward to working with you!

title: once a kid, now a co-founder? ios development specialist
description:
At Minc, we get amazed every day, and nothing surprises us anymore. Ideas come to us that turn life's truths upside down, solving global problems or, even better, everyday problems worldwide, finding their life forms as successful startups.‍


Minc accompanies our startups from 'what if' to the first written business plan to investors, customers, employees, and - if you wish - exit. With us, innovators and entrepreneurs simply get the help they need to build their universe, and we are just as passionate about their ideas as they are.‍


Being part of the Minc team means being a great ambassador for Minc by promoting the brand and representing Minc in external spaces. Speak and act according to our values (brave, curious, sustainable, warmly professional) with colleagues, entrepreneurs, boards, owners, and external parties.‍


Since the magic often happens next to the coffee machine we are an office-first company. Running a startup is a roller coaster, if a founder needs a hug, quick feedback, or a high five after they have landed a term sheet, we will be there.‍

 **The role**


Remember the rush of spotting that one toy you couldn’t stop thinking about as a kid?
  

We're betting on that feeling still in all of us, to build a different game making sure no toys are left behind.


Are you a creative **iOS developer** and lifelong toy lover eager to build and make a difference? Become a pivotal part of **give give**, a startup tackling toy waste by building a circular economy **by** kids, **for** kids.

**Who We Are:** At **give give**, we’re reimagining playtime by building a family game experience that turns toys into something more focused swapping them-right in your neighborhood. Our goal:

* Reduce plastic waste via circular play


* Build stronger communities with shared experiences. Co-founded by Ninon and Adrien, two conscious designers, we’ve successfully piloted our platform, earning spots as finalists in international competitions for sustainability and innovation like BeVisioneer financed by Mercedes-Benz or THU Talent Leagues. Now pre-incubated at MINC, between malmö and copenhagen, we’re just getting started—and that’s where you come in.
 **Your Role:** As our **iOS Development Specialist**, you’ll be the technical lead behind a gamified toy-swapping app that blends the digital and physical worlds. This is a chance to help shape not just an app, but the future of sustainable play.

**What's There:**

* A beta iOS version ready to build upon.
* A structured backend & database with data collection principles.
* A co-designed approach, to build and prototype with kids at our physical toy-swap events.
* A strong focus on UX accessibility, data privacy, and minor protection.
* A network of advisors with decades of experience in gaming, sustainability, and marketing.

 **What You’ll Bring:**

* An **Expert in iOS app development** (SwiftUI, CoreGraphics, CoreAnimation)
* A nerd for **product development** and gamification hooks
* A *devoted* activist or supporter in sustainability advocating for impact.
* With a Love for getting your hands dirty 'metaphorically' when it comes to **prototyping and hands-on tasks**
* Experience in the startup world—whether you’ve built your own or contributed to others—you thrive on disruption and solution-making
* With Strong **collaboration skills** in a dynamic and possibly (remote) team environment
* A visionary spirit with a knack for thinking outside the toy box.
* Bonus: if you're fluent in Swedish or a Nordic language.
* The (Real) bonus: kids kids kids. you're a caring mom/dad, or the fun aunt/uncle, or the go-to big sibling when it comes to kids.

 **What You’ll Do:**

* **Lead iOS app development** for our platform from beta to launch
* Elevate the user experience, merging digital and physical play
* Collaborate on the strategic direction of the product
* Build engaging interactivity between the app and real-world play

 **Technologies We Use:**

* SwiftUI
* CoreGraphics
* CoreAnimation
* Bonus: Next.js, Node.js, Cloudflare d1 database, Cloudflare worker, Gemini API, Websocket…

 **Why Join Us?**

* Be a **pioneer in a planet-positive venture**
* Work with a **mission-driven** team creating real-world impact
* Influence the consumption habits of future generations of kids
* Gain **equity and co-founder status**

  

While we are currently **bootstrapping**, reinforce we already: we’re actively seeking funding and exploring a cooperative structure to ensure **equal treatment and voice** for all future team members.

**How to Apply:** Ready to make a difference? Send your CV, portfolio, and a brief explanation of why you're excited to join **give give** to givegiveteam@gmail.com

**Let’s make toys (and technology) playful again.**

title: UX/UI Designer
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere by Rethinking IT. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons, while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**We are currently looking for a highly skilled UX/UI Designer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please be aware that a valid work permit is a mandatory requirement to be considered for the role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Design high-quality and user-friendly interfaces for web and mobile. Examples: UniFi Network app, UniFi Protect app, UniFi Design System, ui.com, store.ui.com, design.ui.com and more
* Embrace a design-first approach, pushing the boundaries of design by working on new and innovative ideas
* Co-work with key stakeholders including leadership, strategists, developers (FE/FS) and other designers
* Navigate an agile work environment, iterating quickly yet maintaining high quality
* Actively participate in mulitple projects across the company and voice your ideas on design improvements


**Requirements**
* Expert level UX and UI design skills
* Minimum five (5) years of experience designing interfaces for web and mobile
* Highly proficient in Figma
* Strong interest in working hands-on with design, considering both user experience and UIs
* You take full ownership of your tasks and responsibilites
* Genuine passion for great UX
* Excellent communication skills and highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Knowledge about networking & wireless technologies
* Experience with Adobe After Effects or any other animation tool for interactions
* Skilled in Cinema 4D or Blender


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: UX designer
description:
**A UX-designer with a good heart, great talent and world-class ambition** 




  





**First things first:** 




*Let’s talk about what really matters, what is truly essential to being a UX-designer at Fairlo.* 




  




* **A passion for doing good things for the users:**



 We believe in a fair world, even when it comes to money. We believe people deserve better. Fairlo is on a mission to level the playing field and outsmart the predatory credit market. This vision dictates that everyone at Fairlo needs to be passionate about doing good, within the framework that is an inherently shitty credit industry. For our new UX-design this means that you need to have a heart and truly care and preferably have experience from financial services or similar and a portfolio to prove it.
 



  




* **A passion for being great at what you do:**



 We’re looking for a hybrid polymath talent, with proven skills and craftsmanship from designing amazing user journeys as well as a knack and passion for making brand values shine through. Striking eye candy, delightful interactive elements and tasty little treats. We live by the credo that there’s never an excuse for being boring, a credo proven in no small part by our UX. By you, that is.
 



  




* **A passion for becoming a world-class leader:**



 We’re aiming high, not only in the scope of our fairness vision but also in terms of how ambitiously we’re approaching UX-design. We want to create a unique product experience that sets a new standard. We want to think new and experiment. We want you to grow with the task, pushing the rest of us to grow alongside you. We have our roots in Stockholm and we’re on the verge of launching in the UK and beyond that, the world. And everything in it.
 



  





**About Fairlo:** 




 With innovative technology as our tool and our desire for equality as our energy, we've come far. But we're nowhere near where we want to be. Our ambition is to help millions of people get access to sustainable finances.
 



  





 In 2018 we launched our first-ever service:
 **Fairlo Varda** 
 . To this date, Varda has helped over 40,000 people access a sustainable and beneficial credit line.
 



  





**We’re also happy to brag about:** 



* Some of Sweden's most experienced business angels and investors share our vision and support our work.
* Won the yearly accelerator program at Sting (Stockholm Innovation & Growth) in 2019, amongst a group of 19 hot startups.
* One of only two Swedish companies on top 10 of Financial Times and Statista's 2024 ranking of Europe's fastest-growing companies.
* Sweden’s only lending B Corp, the world’s leading impact certification.
* Licensed in the UK with our first customers active.
* A team spread across three countries, all working for a fair(lo) world.
* Almost 4000 reviews on Trustpilot, with an average rating of 4.7, 90% of these raving five star reviews.
* Our very own tech hub on Crete, developing our proprietary innovations.
* Not to forget; a competitive benefit package, a hybrid work model and a fun and caring culture that will help you to grow with us.



  





**But most importantly, we’d like to brag about our culture:** 




 The Fairlo culture that we cherish and are very proud of, is characterized by truly caring for each other, teamwork, courage and respect - and of course a burning passion for trying to do good and be fair in everything we do. We are convinced our strong and kind culture is one of the main reasons for Fairo's success. We are now looking for a natural team player and people oriented superstar to join us as our UX-lead and help us become an even greater place to be and the best global financial partner out there, all based on a culture of fairness.
 



  





**What you’ll do:** 



* Take active part in making the business strategy come alive, making sure our business objectives, brand ambition and user experience philosophies converge into something truly unique.
* Take lead in designing the flow and logic of the product experience, including developing actual product features.
* Work closely, collaborate and communicate with the tech, product, marketing teams and cross-functional stakeholders to understand requirements and provide your thoughtful solutions & expertise.
* Integrate user feedback and business requirements into ongoing product experience updates.
* Lead the development of high-fidelity UI/UX design assets for features and products.
* Maintain and evolve the Fairlo design system and keep consistency across product and brand.
* Create user flows, wireframes to build user interface mockups, prototypes and iterating on them with product owners and stakeholders.
* Own all sides of design from concept to launch: storyboards, user flows, mockups, prototypes, and pixel perfect assets.
* Conduct user studies, competitive research and usability tests.
* Maintain consistency in visual elements and ensure that our design system and philosophy is applied across all the products.
* Make the user experience effortless & effective.
* Inspire, motivate, develop and bring out the best in all of us focused on teamwork & support.



  





**We believe you have:** 



* Minimum 5 years of professional experience in creating amazing user experiences with a proven effect, to the benefit of the user as well as business and brand.
* Strong knowledge of web design principles, usability and accessibility as well as design systems and responsive design.
* Impressive experience from product design using creative tools like Figma and on top of best design practices.
* Experience from user monitoring tools like Logrocket, using these to iterate on design.
* Prior experience in such a role making great software products and mobile/web app designs from start to finish.
* Excellent portfolio of UX-design solutions across a spectrum of platforms and software products.
* Experience in user research, usability studies, personas.
* Familiarity with prototyping tools.
* Demonstrated experience working with a design system, its curation, maintenance, and dissemination.
* The ability to challenge ideas and think in new ways.
* Understanding or prior experience of fintech would be a plus.
* Excellent eye for detail and a self-motivated problem solver.
* Strong decision-making abilities.







  





**Benefits** 




 Joining Fairlo means:
 


* You get to be part of building a financial world you’d like to live in.
* A competitive salary and benefits package including stock options program, health insurance, pension, health & wellness allowance.
* Hybrid working framework.
* High-end laptop and equipment.
* Top location in Stockholm or Heraklion.
* Be part of a team that supports each other, have fun together and thrive.



  





**Language:** 




 Working proficiency in written and spoken English.
 







**Where you'll work:** 




 This position is based in Stockholm, London or Heraklion, and includes some travel to the other locations.
 



  





 We believe in finding people with unique backgrounds and perspectives ready to change the world through their visions. We hope we've piqued your interest.

title: UI Designer | Candy Crush Saga
description:
**Craft:**
 UX & UI
   

  

**Job Description:**
 Are you ready to take our players on an incredible journey? Do you aspire to create the world’s best mobile games? We are seeking UI talent to help us level up and ensure our games are as inclusive and engaging as possible. You’ll drive our team forward to deliver unforgettable experiences that delight players across the world
   

  

 Your role within our Kingdom
   

  

 As a talented UI Designer, you’ll work closely with UX and game designers, user researchers, developers, game artists and technical artists. Collaborating with other specialists in your feature team, UI lead and producers, you will work on the effective and optimised user interface systems and new player-centric features for Candy Crush. You are following your passion for interaction and communication design and strive to learn more about it applying these design principles in practice.
   

  

 As a member of the Candy team you’ll participate in a cross-location collaboration. We believe your communication and organisation skills will help you to champion our cooperation on features and information exchange among the teams.
   

  

 Skills to create Thrills
   

  

* You have experience in UI design
* You have a well-developed sense of visual aesthetics
* You understand the need of assets optimisation and keen on technical constraints
* You can apply interaction and communication design to your work
* You are a proactive and reliable team player
* You have good communication and organizational skills
* You are willing to expand your professional knowledge


 Bonus Points
   

  

* Experience in UI design for games, mobile games as a plus
* Experience in UI implementation with game engines
* Skills in animation, motion design and/or special effects
* Interested in typography and iconography
* Experience working with design specs
* Experience working in an agile project environment


 A portfolio demonstrating all aspects of your skill, including any relevant personal projects, is required.
   

  

**About King**
 At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Product Designer - CRM and Customer Engagement
description:
Role Overview:
 



 We are seeking a talented Product Designer with a focus on CRM and customer engagement to join our growing solutions team. This individual will be responsible for designing consumer-centric journeys and scalable design systems across digital touchpoints, including email, in-app, and web communication. The ideal candidate will thrive in Figma, translating complex ideas into seamless, intuitive experiences that drive engagement and retention.
 



  





 Responsibilities 🧑‍💻
 



  





 Journey design:
 


* Design and prototype end-to-end user journeys across CRM channels such as email, rich push notifications, in-app messages, and web messaging.
* Map and optimise customer touchpoints to enhance the user experience and drive measurable engagement outcomes.
* Collaborate with CRM strategists, marketers, and developers to implement user-centered design principles across all engagement initiatives.



  





 Design systems:
 


* Develop and maintain scalable design systems that ensure consistency across multiple channels and platforms.
* Build reusable Figma component libraries for rapid design and iteration across different communication channels.
* Ensure all designs are responsive, accessible, and aligned with brand guidelines.



  





 Collaboration:
 


* Work closely with the Tech Specialist, CRM teams, and external partners to design for personalisation and data-driven experiences.
* Partner with developers to ensure accurate implementation of design specs and interactions.
* Participate in design reviews and provide constructive feedback to improve overall team output.
* Present and align with various stakeholders across the clients' business.



  





 Operational delivery:
 


* Lead the design execution of CRM campaigns and automations, delivering high-quality design assets that meet project deadlines.
* Prototype interactive elements and micro-interactions to enhance communication effectiveness.
* Analyse A/B testing with the execution team to inform design decisions and optimise engagement.



  





 Innovation and trends:
 


* Stay current with design and technology trends within CRM and digital engagement.
* Experiment with emerging technologies and design approaches to drive innovation in customer communication.
* Advocate for design thinking and customer-centricity within the organisation.



  





 Agency life:
 


* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to explain design decisions to non-design stakeholders.
* Ability to present information to clients in a visually engaging and easy-to-understand way, ensuring clarity and simplicity in complex design concepts.



  





 Qualifications 🧑‍🏫
 


* Proven experience (3-5 years) as a Product Designer, UX/UI Designer, or similar role, with a focus on CRM, lifecycle marketing, or customer engagement.
* Experience working within a consultancy or agency environment, managing multiple clients and projects.
* Strong proficiency in Figma, including creating component libraries and prototyping.
* A solid understanding of designing for email, push notifications, and in-app/web experiences.
* Experience working with customer data, personalisation, and dynamic content in design workflows.
* Strong portfolio showcasing CRM or engagement design work.
* Understanding of Email specific design considerations such as dark mode optimisation, accessibility and functionality/compatibility constraints.



  





 Nice to have ❤️
 


* Experience designing for fintech, SaaS, or subscription-based products.
* Familiarity with Braze, Iterable, or similar customer engagement platforms.
* Experience with Stripo or similar no-code editors.
* Looking forward hearing from you!

title: User Researcher
description:
At Viaplay Group, we entertain millions of people every day through our streaming services, radio networks, and TV channels. We believe in the power of content not just as a way of telling stories and touching lives, but also expanding worlds.
   

  

 We’re looking for the best people to join us on our journey. Right now, we’re searching for a
 **User Researcher** 
 in our
 **Stockholm** 
 office – are you ready to hit play on an exciting career change?
   

  

**The Role**
 In this role, you will be responsible for driving the user-centred design research within the Product Area: Retention. The product area consists of four teams with established missions that contribute to increased customer satisfaction and lifetime within the customer segments and sports area. Your responsibilities will include conducting diverse user research initiatives to inform both strategic and tactical product decisions. You will collaborate closely with a Product Analyst to combine quantitative and qualitative data into meaningful and actionable insights.
   

  

**Some Of Your Responsibilities Will Include**
* Plan and conduct user experience research throughout the design process, from generative to evaluative studies
* Analyze and synthesize research results to generate insights that influence the development of our products and services
* Communicate customer insights to teams and stakeholders through the best suitable format, such as personas, customer journeys, workshops, and reports
* Inspire and coach cross-functional teams in conducting their own research
* Utilize both data-driven and user-driven insights to drive product decisions
* Facilitate user research across multiple platforms, including iOS, Android, web, and big screens
* Work closely with development teams, Product Managers, Researchers, Product Analysts, and Designers to maximize customer value and enhance research operations


**What We’re Looking For**
 We understand you may feel confident ticking certain boxes more than others and that’s why we always keep an open mind in our recruitment process. But, in order to thrive in this role, we do believe you’ll have at least some experience in the following:
   

  

* You have solid experience working with mixed methods, are passionate about customers’ needs, and have a strong understanding of the product development process and the value of working in a data- and insight-driven manner
* We believe you have a wide toolkit of qualitative research methods that you can decisively apply depending on the problem space at hand
* Previous experience working together with cross-functional product teams and understanding the iterative processes to continuously improve the experience for users
* Experience with leading user research projects for products on multiple platforms, and with a good understanding of best practices and UX guidelines (such as iOS, Android, web, and big screens)
* You are a great communicator who can advocate for users and their needs within the organization. You are self-organized and proactive as a person and don’t mind finding ways to reach your goals
* Has an educational background in psychology, anthropology, sociology, human-computer interaction, or a deep experience in conducting user research in product organizations


 What we offer you
   

  

* We’ve got you covered! 30 days of paid vacation every year, an attractive pension and insurance scheme, and generous parental leave pay lift.
* Your wellbeing matters. We provide you with various wellbeing initiatives including wellness allowance.
* A safe space to grow and up-skill. Our learning culture puts you in the driver’s seat of your own development.
* An innovative environment with Hack Days once a year. This week-long initiative allows you to think outside the box and deliver creative, technical solutions that (more often than not) go on to be implemented, either in our product or our ways of working.
* Entertainment is what we love, and entertainment is what we do. So, unlimited access to Viaplay seems only fair for you to get to know the product – including serier & viewing events, new release movie rentals, linear channels and more.


**Hit play** 
**today**
 If this feels like your kind of challenge, make sure you apply by attaching your CV here – you may also want to add your LinkedIn profile. Please don’t send us your application via email because we won’t be able to accept it. We do, however, welcome any questions you may have about this particular position.
   

  

 Want to learn more about who we are and what we do? Check out our careers page or follow us on Instagram! We’re only ever a few clicks away.

title: Product Marketing Manager
description:
**Stockholm**
 MAJORITY is a groundbreaking mobile banking service built for migrants, by migrants. Global migration is a 21st-century reality, whether people are following their dreams, love, or new experiences. Our purpose at MAJORITY is to empower the ambitious, the brave, and the talented and help them achieve their dreams. We believe that everyone deserves the same opportunity to succeed. Thus, our mission is to provide migrants the tools they need to thrive in their new country. Come join us!
   

  

 We are MAJORITY, people without borders from 20+ countries around the world. The most important thing for us is working with ambitious people who are passionate about making a difference and keen to help us achieve our mission. Does that sound like you? Then we’d love to hear from you.
   

  

 We are looking for a passionate Product marketing manager to join our Product team’s exciting journey in building and rolling out the premiere banking and multi-service solutions for migrants and internationals. You will be deeply embedded in the product team working together with Product managers, Designers and marketeers on go-to-market strategies, product communication, UX copy and tons of other exciting stuff.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
**Product Marketing**
* Develop and execute go-to-market strategies for new product features and updates within the mobile banking app.
* Craft compelling messaging that communicates the value proposition to various customer segments across channels.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product, design, and engineering, to align product positioning with market needs and user feedback.
* Conduct competitive analysis to understand market trends, identify opportunities, and refine positioning.
* Create sales enablement materials such as product one-pagers, FAQs, and presentations to support internal teams.
* Track and analyze key performance metrics to optimize marketing efforts and improve product adoption.


**Branding**
* Develop and implement brand experiences for new products and features that align with the existing MAJORITY app's identity and tone of voice.
* Ensure consistency in brand messaging across all customer touchpoints, including in-app content, marketing campaigns, and external communications.
* Collaborate with design, product, and marketing teams to create cohesive, user-focused branding elements that enhance the customer journey.
* Maintain and evolve the MAJORITY brand guidelines to reflect the growth of new product offerings while maintaining core brand values.
* Identify opportunities to strengthen brand awareness and loyalty through storytelling and customer-centric content.
* Manage brand-related projects to ensure alignment with overall product and marketing strategies, meeting deadlines and quality standards.


**UX Copywriting**
* Write clear, concise, and user-centric copy for in-app messages, onboarding flows, transactional notifications, and error messages.
* Ensure the voice and tone of the app copy aligns with the brand guidelines and resonates with users.
* Collaborate with product designers and product managers to ensure the copy enhances the user experience and guides users through app interactions smoothly.
* Develop a style guide for in-app copy to maintain consistency across all touchpoints within the app.


**Managing Translations into Spanish**
* Oversee the end-to-end translation process of app content.
* Collaborate with translation vendors or in-house translators to ensure accuracy, cultural relevance, and compliance with regulatory requirements.
* Implement a quality assurance process to review Spanish translations before publishing to ensure consistency with brand voice and tone.
* Manage timelines and workflows for translation projects, ensuring timely delivery of Spanish content for product releases.
* Monitor user feedback from Spanish-speaking users to continuously improve the quality and effectiveness of translations.


**Qualifications**
* 4+ years of experience in Product Marketing or Product Management
* Bachelor’s degree preferred
* Proven expertise in storytelling and content creation, while maintaining consistent brand voice across a variety of channels
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to clearly and concisely articulate across teams


**If you’re interested in joining our mission as** 
**Product Marketing Manager** 
**, please apply by submitting your CV.**
 We believe in equal opportunity and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Growth Specialist
company_industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals
description:
*Are you an
 **entrepreneurial** 
 person motivated by solving challenges for startups and scale-ups? Do you have a
 **growth mindset** 
 , with a perception that every failure is an opportunity to learn? Are you also a
 **system thinker** 
 with a digital marketer background that enjoys the fast-paced startup environment where you get the chance to work with driven, inspiring and humble people? Then, join us on our mission to create a world where good ideas become successful.*
**About The Job**
 As a senior growth specialist, you will be the leading force that make sure that our B2B/B2C startups and scale-ups always put the end customers in the front-seat and base their decisions on data. You are the driving force and key player behind the iterative process and will steer the team toward its set goal and growth. In your role as a senior growth specialist, you will work with data-driven funnel marketing (the ARRR metrics) on a strategic level across the funnel. A large part of your work will also be hands-on work in the top of the funnel with SEO, SEM, paid social, email-marketing and other channels.
   

  

 Your work includes leading and setting up the growth process that enables the client to work experiment-based, which includes education, project management and creating a baseline for analytics. You will, continuously test initiatives, execute on ideas and analyze the experiments in order to find what drives growth and an increase in company valuation.
   

  

 At VNTRS we work with a variety of clients and startups in different stages, which means that your work also could include business development such as pricing and creating go-to-market strategies.
   

  

**Must-have Requirements**
* +5 years working experience from growth marketing, setting up and optimizing digital marketing channels.
* +5 years working experience from paid social/SEM/SEO
* Knowledge about CRO
* Experience in setting up and analyzing web and app
* Experience from working with both b2b and b2c
* Project management skills
* Great change management skills
* Fluent in Swedish and English


**Nice-to-have requirements** 
  

  

* Have experience from working at a Startup or as a consultant
* Business development skills
* Copywriting skills
* Hands on start-up experience


**About VNTRS**
 Our vision is a world where good ideas become successful. Because we believe that too many good ideas and passionate entrepreneurs and intrapreneurs fall short due to the wrong reasons - we are here to change this. We help to build digital products and services while also helping them get to market in a cost-effective way. If we believe in the people and the companies we work with, we are willing to reinvest part of our fee for equity to become shareholders and long-term tech partners. Our investment portfolio currently consists of 20 early stage tech companies that we’ve helped build, and we have helped hundreds of clients to work according to the VNTRS way of working.
   

  

 We are currently 40 coworkers and at VNTRS we like to share risk and to have skin in the game. To partner up with promising entrepreneurs/corporations and share the risk and upside together with
 **all** 
 our co-workers is one of the cornerstones of VNTRS.
   

  

**Why VNTRS?** 
 Our values build on being caring, adventurous and inspiring. You will be part of a tightly knitted team that is passionate about building the products of tomorrow together. We encourage an entrepreneurial mindset and we have fun together. At VNTRS we share the success among all co-workers through ownership in our investment fund with tech startups.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Ownership in our investment fund with tech startups All employees get a monthly equity bonus used to invest in VNTRS investment fund with tech startups.
* Challenging Responsibilities: Real responsibility from day one. Together we create your personal development plan, based on your career goals, and give the senior support guidance you need to achieve it.
* Great work-life balance Every Friday we all gather for a social lunch on the house and end the week with a common after work at the office. At VNTRS we really believe in having fun at work and encourage a healthy work-life balance.
* Generous Benefits Yearly travel conference and a lot of fun events and afterworks


 VNTRS is a venture studio that helps entrepreneurs and large corporations to build innovative digital products and services. In some cases we invest part of our fee in exchange for equity, so-called sweat equity investments.
   

  

 Our team consists of software developers, UI/UX designers, product and project managers, brand experts, and growth specialists.

title: Är du vår nästa Team Manager?
description:
Som relationsbyggare med inspirerande ledarskap får du möjligheten att påverka både din egen och dina medarbetares vardag i en dynamisk arbetsmiljö. Låter det som en utmaning för dig? Läs vidare och skicka in din ansökan redan idag!
   

  

**Vad rollen innebär**
 I rollen som Team Manager kommer du att ingå i ledningsgruppen som ansvarar för att leda och utveckla avdelningen, samt bygga långsiktiga relationer med våra kunder. För oss är långsiktigt relationsbyggande och ett öppet samarbetsklimat centrala värderingar som styr oss i alla kundkontakter.
   

  

 Du leder dina medarbetare med fokus på utveckling och innovation inom eftermarknadsinformation, där vi arbetar med både svenska och internationella kunder. På vår avdelning i Stockholm jobbar över 40 specialister inom teknisk kommunikation, informationsarkitektur, UX och tekniska illustrationer.
   

  

 I din roll kommer du att coacha och motivera dina medarbetare att fortsätta leverera innovativa och nytänkande informationslösningar.
   

  

 Du kommer bland annat att ansvara för:
   

  

* Medarbetarsamtal och lönesättning
* Rekrytering och utveckling av dina medarbetare
* Projektledning av strategiska projekt, internt och externt
* Budget- och resultatuppföljning
* Bygga och upprätthålla starka kundrelationer


**Vem du är**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* Ett stort intresse för att utveckla medarbetare och avdelningar
* Erfarenhet av ledarskap och personalansvar
* Intresse för merförsäljning och affärsutveckling
* En akademisk examen
* Obehindrade kunskaper i svenska och engelska


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från konsultbranschen eller eftermarknadsinformation
* Teknisk kompetens med erfarenhet från teknikutveckling, gärna från techbranschen


 Du är en relationsbyggare som skapar förtroende och engagemang, med en ledarstil som inspirerar och skapar rätt förutsättningar för dina medarbetares framgång.
   

  

**Vad vi erbjuder**
 På Aleido bidrar du till vårt syfte: att överbrygga klyftan mellan teknik och människorna som använder den. Att arbeta tillsammans med människor med olika bakgrunder och erfarenheter breddar vår förståelse för mänskligt beteende. Vi erbjuder en miljö där medarbetarna är i fokus. Där samarbete, framåtanda och dina unika perspektiv värdesätts. Som medarbetare på Aleido kan du vara trygg med att:
   

  

* Du är här av en anledning. Varje individ har mycket att bidra med, och vi vill att du ska lyckas.
* Du kommer få den stöttning du behöver för att lyckas, samtidigt som du kommer bli utmanad i att driva din utveckling framåt.
* Vår lärandekultur hjälper oss att bryta ny mark. Med vårt löfte för lärande lovar vi att generöst dela kunskap, skapa möjligheter för lärande och värdera initiativ att lära.
* Vi är öppensinnade och framtidsinriktade. Det innebär att hållbarhet är kärnan i vårt erbjudande, både direkt och indirekt.


**Vilka vi är**
 Aleido är ett internationellt företag i framkanten av utvecklingen av eftermarknadsinformation och utbildningslösningar. Våra kunder utvecklar komplexa produkter eller system, eller söker kunskap och beredskap för att skapa varaktig förändring, inom en mängd branscher såsom fordon, telekom, industri, järnväg och medicinteknik. Vi är närmare tusen kollegor i fem länder. Tillsammans överbryggar vi klyftan mellan teknik och människorna som är beroende av den – genom att göra det avancerade lätt att förstå.

title: Strategisk inköpare IT Feb 2025
description:
**Strategiska inköpare**


Är du intresserad av att arbeta som strategisk inköpare i en stor och välutvecklad inköpsorganisation och samtidigt vara med och göra Försvarsmakten till Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vill du dessutom bidra till att försvara Sverige, landets intressen, vår frihet och rätt att leva som vi själva väljer.


**Om enheten**  

Försvarsmaktens Inköpsenhet är placerad inom FMLOG (Försvarsmaktens logistikförband) och ansvarar för Försvarsmaktens upphandlingar och inköp i enlighet med gällande upphandlingslagstiftning. Det arbetet vi genomför är avgörande för Försvarsmaktens försörjning samt strategiska och operativa förmåga. Vi arbetar enligt en fastställd kategoristyrd metodik och arbetar kontinuerligt med kompetensutveckling.


Inköpsenheten består av totalt sju avdelningar geografiskt spridda i Sverige. Denna tjänst är förlagd till avdelning IT varor och tjänster i Stockholm med fokus på upphandling inom IT- och ledningssystemområdet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att ta ett stort eget ansvar samtidigt som du arbetar inom ditt kategoriteam. Vi värdesätter våra medarbetare och på avdelningen är vi prestigelösa, hjälpsamma och vårdar ett ömsesidigt förtroende.


**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**  

I din roll som strategisk inköpare kommer du bland annat:


* Självständigt planera och genomföra upphandlingar av varierande komplexitet, alltifrån utveckling av kommersiella strategier, genomförande av behovsanalyser och marknadsundersökningar inför upphandling samt utveckla upphandlingsdokument, utföra anbudsutvärderingar och leda leverantörsförhandlingar.
* Ansvara för att upprätthålla starka affärsrelationer till våra leverantörer och säkra kontinuerlig förvaltning och uppföljning av dina avtal.
* Bygga och vidmakthålla starka relationer med våra beställare/kunder.
* Delta i olika inköpsrelaterade projekt.


**Kvalifikationer**  

För att lyckas i denna position behöver du ha:


* Akademisk examen inom juridik, ekonomi, logistik, inköp eller relaterat område, eller en yrkesutbildning med kommersiell inriktning och relevant arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Utmärkta kommunikationsfärdigheter på svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift.
* Gedigna kunskaper i MS Office, inklusive Powerpoint, Excel och Word.


**Meriterande**  

Meriterande egenskaper för tjänsten inkluderar;


* Erfarenhet av kategoristyrt inköp.
* Erfarenhet av LOU och LUFS
* Erfarenhet av upphandling inom IT-området
* Kunskap om mjukvara och licensmodeller
* Avtalsrätt eller förvaltningsrätt.
* Arbete i stora komplexa organisationer.
* Arbeta i organisationer under förändring.


**Personliga egenskaper**  

Vi värdesätter en person som är noggrann, analytisk, lösningsfokuserad samt har förmågan att sammanföra människor och bygga starka relationer till dina kunder och intressenter. Vi söker en person som är professionell, självgående samt har en förmåga att överblicka behov och se helheten för att tillgodose Försvarsmaktens inköpsbehov. Det är viktigt att du är en lagspelare och värdesätter laget före jaget.


**Övrigt**  

Tillträde snarast enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med 6 månaders provanställning. Befattningen är placerad i Stockholm och arbete sker på plats.


Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Emanuel Liljeblom, Stf Avdelningschef IT-varor och tjänster, telefon: 070-148 94 91


**Fackliga representanter**  

Samtliga nås via växeln: 08-788 75 00.  

SEKO Eva-Britt Steen  

SACO-s Madeleine Bagge  

Försvarsförbundet OFR/S Helena Strid  

OFR/O of-fmlog@mil.se


**Sista ansökningsdag**  

Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-03-02! Du ansöker via Försvarsmaktens hemsida. Din ansökan ska innehålla CV samt ansökningsbrev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning.

title: Inköpssamordnare IT Stockholm Feb 2025
description:
**Inköpssamordnare**


Är du intresserad av att arbeta som inköpssamordnare i en stor och välutvecklad inköpsorganisation och samtidigt vara med och göra Försvarsmakten till Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vill du dessutom bidra till att försvara Sverige, landets intressen, vår frihet och rätt att leva som vi själva väljer.


**Om enheten**  

Försvarsmaktens Inköpsenhet är placerad inom FMLOG (Försvarsmaktens logistikförband) och ansvarar för Försvarsmaktens upphandlingar och inköp i enlighet med gällande upphandlingslagstiftning. Det arbete vi genomför är avgörande för Försvarsmaktens försörjning samt strategiska och operativa framgång. Vi arbetar enligt en fastställd kategoristyrd metodik och arbetar kontinuerligt med kompetensutveckling.


Inköpsenheten består av sju avdelningar geografiskt spridda i Sverige. Denna tjänst är förlagd till avdelning IT varor och tjänster i Sthlm med fokus på upphandling inom IT- och ledningssystemområdet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att ta ett stort eget ansvar samtidigt som du arbetar inom ditt kategoriteam samt ut mot Försvarsmaktens förband. Vi värdesätter våra medarbetare och på avdelningen, är vi prestigelösa, hjälpsamma och vårdar ett ömsesidigt förtroende.


**Huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter**  

Som Inköpssamordnare kommer du arbeta med inköpsstyrning och inköpssamordning samt uppföljning och förbättringsåtgärder kopplat till mål- och nyckeltal inom tilldelade kategorier. I rollen funktionsstyr du tilldelade avropare som nyttjar Försvarsmaktens befintliga avtal och är även kontaktperson mot vissa utpekade förband. Arbetet bedrivs genom hela inköpsprocessen från strategiskt till operativt inköp där du svarar för att rutiner och riktlinjer följs. En del av din vardag är att ha en kontinuerlig dialog med våra interna kunder inom Försvarsmakten avseende avtal, instruktioner och inköpssystem. Du kommer även att ha kontakt med våra leverantörer och arbeta tillsammans med våra strategiska inköpare för att sköta löpande uppföljning, analys och utveckling av våra avtal. Du kommer även att ingå i vår interna utbildnings-pool och kommer att löpande hålla i utbildningar på inköpsområdet inom Försvarsmakten.


**Kvalifikationer**  

Erfarenheter och kunskaper som krävs för tjänsten inkluderar:

  

* Relevant akademisk utbildning, yrkesutbildning med kommersiell inriktning eller motsvarande kunskaper inhämtade från relevant arbetslivserfarenhet
* Mycket goda kunskaper i MS Office (Powerpoint, Excel, Word)
* Mycket god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift, både på svenska och på engelska


**Personliga egenskaper**  

Du är en resultatinriktad och självgående person som tycker om och har god förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team. Att arbeta med flera uppgifter samtidigt är något du trivs med och du har lätt för att anpassa dig till förändrade omständigheter. Du har även god analytisk förmåga och kan med hjälp av tillgänglig data dra slutsatser och ta fram förbättringsförslag. Du planerar och strukturerar ditt arbete väl för att nå uppsatta mål inom angivna tidsramar. Rollen ställer också krav på serviceanda och vilja att hjälpa andra till att leverera lösningar som leder till resultat. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.


**Meriterande kvalifikationer**  

Det är meriterande om du har någon eller några av dessa erfarenheter:


* Kategoristyrt inköpsarbete
* Kunskaper inom LOU och/eller LUFS
* Arbete med avtalsuppföljning
* Erfarenhet av att hålla i utbildningar


**Övrigt**  

Tillträde snarast enligt överenskommelse. Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Befattningen är placerad i Stockholm och arbete sker på plats. Arbetsprov kan förekomma vid rekryteringen.


**Upplysningar om tjänsten och rekryteringsprocessen**  

Vill du veta mer om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta:


Emanuel Liljeblom, Stf Avdelningschef IT-varor och tjänster, telefon 072-973 08 74.


**Fackliga representanter**  

Samtliga nås via växeln: 08-788 75 00.  

SEKO Eva-Britt Steen  

SACO-s Madeleine Bagge  

Försvarsförbundet OFR/S Helena Strid  

OFR/O of-fmlog@mil.se


**Sista ansökningsdag**  

Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-03-02. Du ansöker via Försvarsmaktens hemsida. Din ansökan ska innehålla CV samt ansökningsbrev där du motiverar varför du är lämpad för denna befattning.

Är du intresserad av att arbeta som inköpare i en stor och välutvecklad inköpsorganisation och samtidigt vara med och göra Försvarsmakten till Sveriges bästa arbetsgivare? Vill du dessutom bidra till att försvara Sverige, landets intressen, vår frihet och rätt att leva som vi själva väljer.
