title: Service Engineer
description:
Service Engineer

  

**Date:** Jan 22, 2025


**Location:** Sweden - Falun


**Company:** Super Micro Computer


**Job Req ID: 25489**
**About Supermicro:**

Supermicro® is a Top Tier provider of advanced server, storage, and networking solutions for Data Center, Cloud Computing, Enterprise IT, Hadoop/ Big Data, Hyperscale, HPC and IoT/Embedded customers worldwide. We are amongst the fastest growing company among the Silicon Valley Top 50 technology firms. Our unprecedented global expansion has provided us with the opportunity to offer many new positions to the technology community. We seek talented, passionate, and committed engineers, technologists, and business leaders to join us to drive accelerated growth and technology-led innovation in the global marketplace.
**Job Summary:**

1st / 2nd line Datacenter System Engineer  

For our branch in the Netherlands (s-‘Hertogenbosch) we are looking for an expansion of our current team of colleagues in the service department to support our customers in Sweden. Supermicro has been a household name in the field of Motherboards, Servers and total solutions for more than 30 years, where we provide service based on service contracts for large customers in various sectors.  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**
**About the job:**  

As a Datacenter System Engineer you are responsible for accepting, registering and solving various problems in the field of server hardware. We analyze and solve problems for our international customers both remotely and at the customer location. This role offers the opportunity to quickly become familiar with many different aspects of IT at various customers. This makes it an excellent opportunity to broaden your knowledge and experience and thus lay the foundation for the future of your career. You will be part of a very close team with a good working atmosphere.
Customer satisfaction is the focus in this position. You get satisfaction from solving problems and can work in an environment with different cultures and nationalities.
You are flexible and willing to travel occasionally to serve our customers.  

**Qualifications:**
**What do we ask of you?**
* A completed (senior) vocational education towards IT or comparable level obtained through experience.
* You have an excellent command of the English language.
* You have experience with 1st and 2nd line support.
* Experience in datacenters is an advantage.
* You have good communication skills.
* Analytic and problem-solving mindset
* You quickly gain knowledge.
* You can perform individually and under pressure.
* You have (basic) knowledge of the Windows OS/Linux.
* You have (basic) knowledge of system management (networks, servers, databases).
* You are representable.
**What do we have to offer you?**  

* A competitive monthly salary.
* An extensive education and training offer within the Supermicro Academy to further develop your knowledge and experience.
* Surrounded by colleagues within your field to brainstorm with.
* Various and challenging assignments.
* A working week based on 40 hours.
* A close team with a good working atmosphere.

  

  

Are you interested after reading this vacancy? Send in your resume and motivation or contact our account manager/recruiter directly.
**EEO Statement**

Supermicro is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity in our employee population. It is the policy of Supermicro to provide equal opportunity to all qualified applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or special disabled veteran, marital status, pregnancy, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.
company_description: Supermicro is a Fortune 1000 company headquartered in the heart of Silicon Valley.

title: Solution Advisor Senior Specialist - S/4HANA
description:
**We help the world run better**

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

 **Senior S/4HANA Solution Advisor**

 **About SAP Company**


As a market leader in application software our purpose is to help the world run better and improve people’s lives. The promise we give is to help our customers to innovate, and to help them to run at their best. SAP empowers people and organizations to work together more efficiently, use business insight more effectively, adapt continuously, and grow sustainable. Here you will find a time to grow. There are no ready-made paths, you can walk and create the way for you. We foster a learning culture since our people is the key to our success.


SAP S/4HANA Cloud is ERP for every business need – from mission-critical operations to business model innovation. You will be part of helping customers adopting their first SAP ERP or migrating from an existing one to the cloud, to gain a complete, modular solution with the AI and analytics capabilities to move your business forward.


Our focus on customers and to help them run at their best has given us the opportunity to grow.  

We are currently looking for a Senior S/4HANA Solution Advisor to join our team in Sweden.

  



**What you'll do:**


As the Solution Advisor (SA), you will be the go-to person for any solution or product questions within the sales team. You will leverage your deep expertise in specific solutions to support the entire sales cycle, from identifying opportunities to post-sale customer support. Additionally, you will assist customers in expanding their current SAP footprint to maximize value for their organization.


Solution below equal to: **S/4HANA Cloud ERP (logistics and manufacturing)** *(NOT SAP Finance)*

* Provide deep Solution-specific expertise to support new sales and adoption for key customers
* Provide both standard and customized/personalized Solution demonstrations that bring SAP solutions to life and show customers the value of SAP.
* Support the Account Team by delivering Solution presentations and events to identify and qualify new opportunities and drive adoption and consumption of SAP solutions
* Establish yourself as a thought leader within the account team and fine-tune account strategy
* Collaborate with the team in creating overall themes and competitive differentiation
* Engage with customers to continue selling the vision of SAP solutions and ensure eagerness for renewal
* Leverage digital assets throughout the customer engagement, including demos, presentations, and other content

 **What you bring:**

* Professional experience with large software/IT organizations, preferably in a solution-specific segment
* 3-5 years Solution experience
* Working knowledge of Cloud, Hosted Services, and Software as a Service/Platform as a Service models in the Business-to-Business Environment
* Viewed as a solutions/Lines of Business/Industry expert across SAP with a track record of success
* Focus on creating compelling storylines and themes for customer interactions
* Ability to quickly understand customer business goals and ensure they are at the center of recommended solutions
* Passion and energy in all customer interactions

  



**Education and Qualifications / Skills and Competencies**

  



**Personal skills:**

* Bachelor equivalent: minimum requirement
* Master equivalent: optional
* Ability to work in international and virtual teams
* Fluency in Swedish and English, any other language an asset.

**Mobility**

* Ability and willingness to travel


**Bring out your best**


SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

**We win with inclusion**


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:**


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.


Requisition ID: 415673 | Work Area: Presales | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid.
company_description: SAP's purpose is to help the world run better and improve people's lives with sustainability at the core.

title: Security Operations Incident Lead
description:
**Ready to inspire change?**
----------------------------

  

Do you step forward when an opportunity arises? What can you see that others don’t in those around you? We are looking for a skilled and passionate **Security Operations Incident Lead** to join our growing team. As a leader in our Security Operations Center (SOC), you will be instrumental in ensuring the effectiveness of our security operations and leading efforts to mitigate risks in a constantly evolving threat landscape. The world of mobility is changing. Come and make your mark.


**Let's introduce ourselves**
-----------------------------

  

The Cyber Defence Centre team’s responsibility is to guide, advise and protect Volvo Cars and its customers by designing and embedding security in everything we do using future proof, automated and data driven solutions, ensuring we stay on the safe side.  

  

Furthermore, advanced analytics will facilitate and guide business functions e.g. by enabling self-service capabilities and providing personalized real-time data insights. This will ensure a more proactive approach to detecting and responding to cybersecurity threats and incidents. Our teams consist of experts in all areas of cybersecurity - Cyber Defence Centre 24/7 Operations, and cybersecurity enablement including an academy, advisory, and data management.


**What you'll do**
------------------

  

Would you like to be a leader in a growing organization and support the advancement of cybersecurity at Volvo Cars? Do you want to be a part of our transformation and our mission to enable the organisation to act correctly around cyber risks? Then this might be the right opportunity for you!  

  

In this role, your primary responsibilities will be to leading and coordinating the response to security incidents, ensuring that all relevant teams are informed and working together effectively to contain and mitigate the impact. Besides this, you will:  

  

* Overseeing the detection of security incidents, analysing data from various security tools, and ensuring timely identification of potential security breaches or suspicious activities.


  

* Managing the investigation of security incidents to understand their origin, impact, and root causes. This may involve forensic analysis, log review, and collaboration with other technical teams.


  

* Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to assess security risks and provide actionable recommendations.


  

* If necessary, working with external vendors, law enforcement, or other agencies to resolve incidents and improve the organization’s overall security posture.

**What you'll bring**
---------------------

  

We are seeking a Security Operations Incident Lead. This is a senior-level position, overseeing Volvo Cars Security Operations Center (SOC) and incident handling. We believe that you have a solid background in SOC processes and best practices, along with technical expertise and a strong passion for operational excellence.  

  

You shall have similar previous experience and skills such as:  

  

- Certified with CISM, CISSP or equivalent, accompanied by practical experience in the field.  

  

- Strong operational background in cybersecurity, with expertise in SIEM platforms, threat intelligence, SOAR, cloud technologies, digital forensics, and incident response procedures.  

  

* Familiar with data-driven and software development practices.


  

* Advanced analytical and problem-solving abilities, capable of identifying and addressing complex challenges effectively.


  

If you are passionate about cybersecurity, enjoy having fun at work, and have a track record of success in managing and leading diverse/distributed teams, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity!  

  

This is a full-time position in Gothenburg, Lindholmen office. We have a hybrid setting where we expect you to be in the office a couple of days a week.  

  

  

**Sounds interesting? Welcome your application!**
-------------------------------------------------

  

We’d love to receive and review your application. We welcome you to apply in English as soon as possible, however no later than 16th of February 2025. Please apply through the provided link. Once you receive a confirmation email from the system, your application will be acknowledged.  



**Volvo Cars - Driving change together**
----------------------------------------

  

Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.  

  

By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Join us on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
company_description: At Volvo Car Group, our vision is clear: "To be the world's most progressive and desired premium car brand".

title: Senior Data Consultant & People Manager
description:
**Are you ready to take your career to the next level? We’re seeking our next People Manager for the Engagement and Advisory unit—a role that combines leadership and hands-on work as a Data professional consultant.**  

  

**As a People Manager, you will build and lead a team of 5-10 consultants, focusing on coaching, career development, and creating a positive work environment. We believe in empowering our managers to prioritize people and clients over administrative tasks.**  

  

**At Capgemini Insights & Data, you will develop both business and technical skills in a supportive work environment that values community and team spirit.**  

  

**What You’ll Do as a People Manager**  

* **Lead by Example: Be the go-to person for our employees, providing guidance and support.**
* **Individual Growth & well-being: Conduct regular 1-on-1s, helping consultants plan their careers and achieve their goals. You will foster engagement and well-being within your team.**
* **Balancing Act & Self-leadership: While supporting your team, maintain your own client-oriented work. Utilization and business development are key.**

**In your day-to-day work, you will be contributing as a Senior Data consultant, wearing different hats depending on the context. But your role and responsibilities are at all times related to Advisory, Project & Engagement Management.**  

  

**What You’ll Do as a Consultant:**  

* **Depending on your role you will work close with our clients and drive initiatives involving data warehouses, analytics, AI, MDM, and strategy development at customer sites.**

  

**YOUR PROFILE**  

* **You are an experienced data professional within the Data, AI & Analytics field, for example as a delivery manager, business analyst, project manager, program manager or engagement manager.**
* **You are driven by creating effective teams and contributing by giving the team members the best possible conditions to achieve smart solutions.**
* **Fluent Swedish skills**
**WHAT WE BELIEVE YOU WILL ENJOY ABOUT WORKING HERE**  

**We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance. At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities. Equip yourself with valuable certifications in the latest technologies such as Databricks and Microsoft Azure or focus on strengthening your leadership skills.**  

  

**APPLICATION**  

**Ready to join our team? Apply Now!**  

  

**ABOUT CAPGEMINI**  

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world while creating a tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fueled by its market-leading capabilities in AI, cloud, and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**  

  

**Get The Future You Want | www.capgemini.com**  

  

**#LI-AKARLSSON**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: People and Capability Leader - SAP Tech
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.


* Do you see the potential in people and have a strong track record as a people manager?
Do your clients and colleagues see you as an advisor where you always bring your best in leveraging SAP solutions to achieve business objective?  
* 

If you’re motivated by playing a crucial role in growing our SAP Tech capability in the Nordics and further develop our people, please read on. You may be the one we’re looking for!


**YOUR ROLE**
-------------

Capgemini are seeking a dynamic and experienced People Manager to lead the SAP Tech team in Stockholm. You will be a part of a Nordic capability team and the role will be combined with presales, delivery activities and people manager responsibility. As a leader you develop our SAP consultants within the tech domain to ensure that our people and business grow, and that we bring world class SAP Tech capabilities to our clients.


In this role, you will play a key role in:


* Driving team performance through effective utilization management, performance evaluations, and competence development
* Leading, mentoring, and motivating a team of senior and junior SAP tech consultants to grow and deliver exceptional results
* Fostering a collaborative and inclusive team environment, promoting open communication and knowledge sharing
* Being an advisor for our clients around SAP processes, identifying areas for improvement, and developing SAP solutions to address their specific needs
* Collaborating with sales and presales teams to develop winning strategies and deliver compelling proposals to clients
* Collaborating with project teams to ensure SAP solutions are integrated seamlessly with existing systems and business processes
* Executing on company strategy to drive business growth and expansion
**YOUR PROFILE**
----------------

* Bachelor's or Master's degree in in related field
* A strong entrepreneurial spirit and thrive in building and developing our business
* Strong people leader skills with the ability to inspire and motivate both senior and junior team members
* Proven experience in SAP and in-depth knowledge in SAP S/4 HANA
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively interact with clients and internal stakeholders
* Proven experience in successful end to end SAP implementations
* Fluency in English is a must; Swedish is a plus
Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: Regulatory Reporting Manager
description:
Role Description
Regulatory reporting manager is a key role within the Regulatory Operations team and will provide:* Oversight for Regulatory Reporting, ensuring timeliness, accuracy and completeness requirements of specific regulations are met
* Trade Surveillance operational oversight and alert management in line with Market Abuse requirements for FNZ Brokerage & Custody function
* Communication of reporting metrics to senior management, internal stakeholders and clients
* Periodic data quality review to ensure accurate and complete reports are being sent to the regulators
* Documentation and implementation of Regulatory Reporting procedures and workflows according to client requirements

  

Team Responsibilities
The Regulatory Operations team is responsible for providing reporting services to FNZ Brokerage & Custody business line and its clients.
The team oversees the submission of regulatory reports and trade surveillance data from upstream client order management and trading systems. The data is validated, enriched and submitted to a third party technical router who submits to the regulatory end point for each reporting regime.
Regulatory reporting submission are monitored for timeliness, accuracy and completeness. Order and trade data is monitored for Market Abuse.  

Specific Role Responsibilities* Oversight of daily monitoring of transaction reporting across all regulations supported including the following jurisdictions: EMIR, MiFIR, ASIC and MAS
* Oversight of daily monitoring of orders and trades for Market Abuse
* Reconciliation of trade data from primary source systems against regulatory submission reports extracted from the regulatory end point
* Responsible for communicating reporting metrics to legal and compliance and escalating reporting breaches and failures.
* Point of contact and vendor liaison for the implementation of Regulatory Reporting services provided by vendor to FNZ.
* Management of the issue remediation process including day to day issue correction and back reporting. Managing resolution of issues upstream providing requirements to make changes to source systems where necessary.
* Horizon scanning and impact analysis of upcoming regulatory changes eg. Regulatory rewrites, MIFIR updates.
* Creating daily procedural steps and outcomes for reporting scenarios
* Attend working groups and conferences on behalf of the firm and disseminate knowledge


Experience required
5 years + Industry experience in Financial Markets essential
Required Knowledge & Skills
Experience* A proven track record of managing Regulatory Reporting projects
* Hands-on experience of EMIR, MIFIR, ASIC and MAS
* Able to work independently and with initiative
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English and a desire to work as part of a global team.
* Excellent organisational, administration and time management skills.


Opportunities* Right from day one, you will work alongside exceptional, multicultural teams - experts in their respective fields - who will inspire and challenge you to make your greatest impact.
* Be part of a highly successful, rapidly growing, global business that is leading the delivery of financial services via cloud computing and partners with some of the world’s largest companies;
* Working in a flexible and agile way that meets the needs of the business and personal circumstances;
* Remuneration, significant financial rewards and career advancement is based on individual contribution and business impact rather than tenure or seniority;
* We provide global career opportunities for our best employees at any of our offices in the UK, EU, US, Canada, South Africa and APAC.


Commitment to Equal Opportunities
At FNZ, we recognise that diversity, equity and inclusion are important factors contributing to our success. We embrace the unique perspective and capabilities of our current and future employees, which will help us continue to drive innovation and achieve our business goals. Recruitment decisions at FNZ are made in a non-discriminatory manner without regard to gender, ethnicity/race, faith, age, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, socio-economic background, disability or military veteran status where all applicants and employees are valued and respected.
In addition, we want to ensure accessibility needs are well supported, if you require specific support please advise us.
#LI-VP1*About FNZ**FNZ is committed to opening up wealth so that everyone, everywhere can invest in their future on their terms. We know the foundation to do that already exists in the wealth management industry, but complexity holds firms back.**We created wealth’s growth platform to help. We provide a global, end-to-end wealth management platform that integrates modern technology with business and investment operations. All in a regulated financial institution.**We partner with over 650 financial institutions and 12,000 wealth managers, with US$1.5 trillion in assets under administration (AUA).**Together with our customers, we help over 20 million people from all wealth segments to invest in their future.*
company_description: FNZ is the global platform opening up wealth.

title: Senior Security Specialist
description:
**Senior Security Specialist**

Our team is owning the Firewalls and Proxies of Telia Company. We oversee issues related to IT security safety and ensure organizations and our business customer’s networks and systems remain protected from all types of cyber threats.


We participate to Service Assurance work in our area (Incident, Problem and Change Management) and support Telia's Product teams by designing and implementing security customer solutions. We work according to DevSecOps so we are building the security solutions and we also operate them.  



  

**As Senior Security Specialist you will…**

In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining and managing the life cycle of Telia’s security solutions, designing network and cloud security solutions, and actively participating in their upkeep. Your tasks will include collaborating with Telia’s cyber security product unit, engaging early in development initiatives, and handling periodic on-call duties as part of 3rd line support. Additionally, you will work on problem-solving and developing applications and scripts for security management tools.


**Who we’re looking for**

You have a degree in IT or/and Telecommunications, and you have a proven experience and good performance of working within IT and Networks. You are not afraid of challenges in your work. You are ready for continuous improvement of your own responsibility area. You are open for international working environment. You own good communication skills, and you are fluent in English language.


You have strong collaboration skills, take initiative, and proactively share ideas. You approach tasks with thoroughness and precision, and you are always eager to expand your knowledge. Your experience includes maintaining security solutions, firewalls, and proxies, as well as several years of work in network and IT environments. You are well-versed in TCP/IP networking and LAN, have cloud experience, and are familiar with Git/GitLab, Python, and other scripting languages.


**We are more than a workplace**

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 18,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.


**Ready to make better happen?**

We´re looking forward to your application by 31/01/2025. Please apply through our recruitment system to keep your data safe, as we can’t accept resumes via email. Required background checks will be performed.


Got questions? Please reach out to Pekka Stenfors, Manager of Network Functions & Security, pekka.stenfors@teliacompany.com
 

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Senior Sales executive- Creative tech
description:
- **Devoteam is a leading IT consulting company with strong roots in Malmö and Halmstad ´s tech community, both as Devoteam and formerly Jayway. We have been around for 25 years and operate in 30 countries with over 11,000 employees. In our Creative Tech entity, we focus on innovative, tailor-made solutions based on long-term partnerships.**

We are driven by a passion for technology and innovation and are committed to creating long-term relationships with both customers and employees. We offer services and comprehensive solutions in cloud, data, app modernization, product design, and more.


Among our initiatives is Øredev , one of Scandinavia's largest developer conferences, which we co-founded.

  
We are currently looking for a skilled Sales Executive with a focus on account management and lead generation. You will be a part of Devoteam's journey of establishing and growing business in Gothenburg for the first time (since expanding is a big part of our goal for 2025). The workplace for this role is Gothenburg's surrounding areas and we expect you to be present at the Devoteam Halmstad office around 1-2 times weekly.
  

  

**Drive Digital Transformation: Become a Creative tech Sales Executive**  

As a Sales Executive for Creative tech at Devoteam, you will play a crucial role in expanding our footprint across the Swedish region.


**In this role, you will have the opportunity to:**

* **Be a trendsetter:** Stay ahead of the curve in the IT landscape and translate market trends into innovative solutions for our clients.
* **Forge strong connections:** Master the art of building and nurturing long-term relationships with both new and existing clients.
* **New opportunities:** Be a natural networker, comfortable with identifying and connecting with potential clients through LinkedIn and other channels. You'll confidently initiate contact and present Devoteam's services.
* **Collaborate to win:** Work closely with our talented developers to craft tailored solutions that exceed client expectations.
* **Drive for results:** Embrace a competitive spirit and be motivated by achieving ambitious goals and contributing to Devoteam's continued success.

  
* 10- 15 years of experience in sales (Experience in sales in the consultancy business is meritorious)
* **Proven Sales Record:** Demonstrated success in acquiring new customers and closing deals in the IT project business, with a focus on software and team-delivery.
* **Solution-Oriented Mindset:** Ability to understand client challenges and translate them into effective solutions.
* **Strong Communication & Presentation Skills:** Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively articulate the value proposition of Devoteam Creative tech.
* **Relationship Builder:** A natural networker who can build rapport and establish trust with clients and internal stakeholders.
* **Results-Driven:** Highly motivated and results-oriented, with a strong work ethic and a commitment to exceeding expectations.
* **Fluent in Swedish and English:** Excellent written and spoken Swedish and English skills are essential. Fluency in a Nordic language is a plus.

  
- **What Devoteam Offers**


	* An exciting and challenging role in an international company.
	* Opportunity to work with the latest technologies and solutions.
	* A flexible and innovative work environment.**Benefits and Practical Information**


	* Paid vacation and pension: We offer 30 days of vacation and occupational pension similar to ITP1.
	* Health and well-being: Health checks over 35+, health grants 5000 SEK.
	* Equipment: You choose tools, either Mac or PC.**Application**  

To apply, please submit your application via the link. We encourage early applications as we review them continuously.


For any questions, please contact our recruiter Sanna Ekelöf. Sanna will be your primary contact throughout the recruitment process.
company_description: Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital strategy, tech platforms, cybersecurity and business transformation.

title: Senior Electronic Design Engineer
description:
Senior Electronic Design Engineer


Swedium Global is the growing System Engineering and Solution Company, offers services like Semiconductor Engineering R&D Services, Embedded Systems Development, Custom Application Software Development, Web and Cloud Application Development, Testing Services, Consultancy and Outsourcing services to our clients across the globe for an onsite and offshore business model. Swedium Global is having presence in Sweden, Finland, Poland, Czech Republic and in India.


Location: **Sweden**


Expected Start date: **March 2025**


Job Name: **Senior Electronic Design Engineer**


We are looking for 2 electronic designers primarily responsible for the design, testing and certification of electronics in our project.


**Specific job duties include**


* System design
* Schema design
* FET, power supply etc.
* Scanning of CAD and mechanical design and connection till own delivery
* Testing with tools like multimeter, oscilloscope, frequency counter etc.
* Climate testing related to temperature, humidity etc.
* Loading and modifying at PCB level
* Certification and testing related to EMC, ESD, safety etc.
* Producer capabilities analysis


**Skills:**


* All experience regarding power supply design is positive. It works a lot with line-, buck- and boost regulators.
* System design is also given strong competence in power tree, memory management etc.
* Production skills are in the background.
* Experience from certification, EMC testing etc.


You can reach out to us at careers@swediumglobal.com


  
Job Overview


* Location : Lund, Sweden
* Vacancy : 2
* Key Skills : Hardware Design, High speed, EMC Certification

title: Solution Advisor Specialist, Sweden, Signavio
description:
**We help the world run better**

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

**What you'll do**  

  

To thrive in this role you are someone who appreciates close collaboration, open communication, and feedback.  

You will be expected to:  

* Strategize, prepare and deliver engaging solution demonstrations, presentations and business cases to prospects and clients that lead to successful sales outcomes with Signavio’s products and services.
* Lead technical process mining evaluations (Proof of Concepts) requiring large-scale data manipulation scenarios.
* Respond to Request for Proposals (RFPs) (functional, technical, security aspects) and deliver timely, detailed, and well-crafted follow-up reports and presentations to client and prospect requests for additional information.
* Develop and maintain expert knowledge of Signavio’s solution suite, competitive product offerings, market intelligence, and unique differentiation.
* Collaborate with Sales enablement and product teams to share market insight and solutions, and work with post-sales delivery teams to ensure long term customer success.
* Provide thought leadership, technical expertise and best practice knowledge around process mining and process management to our prospects and customers.


  

**What you bring**  

* Presales and Enterprise Solution Consulting experience, ideally within the field of Business Process Management
* Deep understanding of key business processes, such as Order-to-Cash, Procure-to-Pay, Make-to-Order, etc.
* A self-starter, you show initiative and enjoy being part of a great team in an international organization.
* Strong presentation and communication skills.
* Familiarity with major ERP systems, data extraction, data analysis, reporting is an advantage.
* Familiarity with process mining and process mining applications.
* Strong analytical skills including value analysis, business case development, ROI calculations, etc.
* Ability to juggle multiple projects among multiple stakeholders (internal and external) simultaneously.
* Willingness to travel e.g. 30%.
* Bachelor’s Degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Business Information Technologies or equivalent experience.


  

**Meet your team**  

  

In this role you will be working in a cross-functional team who values trust, respect and diversity. We are looking for people who share our passion for creating products that people love to use.  

**Bring out your best**


SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

**We win with inclusion**


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

**EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:**


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.


Requisition ID: 404125 | Work Area: Presales | Expected Travel: 0 - 30% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time | Additional Locations: #LI-Hybrid.

title: RISE with SAP Chief Enterprise Architect
description:
**We help the world run better**

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

**Meet Your Team**


Join our dynamic SAP Enterprise Architects team within the new SAP Customer Services & Delivery board. We lead digital transformation using cutting-edge SAP technologies, advancing the RISE with SAP initiative, promoting Clean Core principles, and accelerating SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) adoption. Our mission is to simplify and modernize IT landscapes, reducing complexity and operational costs, while fostering innovation and efficiency to support evolving business needs.

 **What you’ll do:**


As a Chief Enterprise Architect, you will develop a comprehensive enterprise architecture model for our customers aligning with their enterprise goals, collaborate with virtual account teams (VAT) as a transformation partner and lead activities such as:

* Guide customers through their cloud journey (with special focus on adopt and derive), starting with Enterprise archetypes and scaling digitally.
* Provide enterprise architecture guidance using RISE with SAP methodology and Clean Core principles to ensure that every customer benefits from SAP‘s cloud qualities.
* Act as the Transformation Partner for the CIO or other CxO, driving architecture effectiveness.
* Support adoption, identifying and mitigating technical adoption risks.
* Align customers and partners with SAP’s Clean Core strategy, accelerate BTP adoption and promote SAP best practices.
* Provide customer context to all teams, enhancing customer proximity and experience.
* Articulate the value of the designed target architecture and possible intermediate/ transition steps as well as provide guidance on the realization of the identified benefits
* Serve as a trusted advisor, ensuring secure, reliable, and flexible cloud environments for mission-critical processes.

 **What You Bring:**


Transformation, Architectural & Solution Skills:

* Extensive Experience delivering enterprise business transformation projects and aligning customer priorities with target architecture and roadmap.
* In-depth knowledge of the SAP Solution Portfolio and Enterprise Architecture Framework (North Star).
* Experience with Business Technology Platform components (application development, automation, data and analytics, integration, AI) and practical experience with S/4HANA applications.
* Strong understanding of Cloud & Clean Core Strategy, familiarity with SAP LeanIX, Signavio, and Cloud ALM.
* Knowledge of SAP's Business AI roadmap, including identifying use cases and piloting AI-driven solutions to enhance business processes.
* Expertise in SAP Integration and Extensibility Advisory Methodologies.

 **Must-Have Requirements:**

* 15+ years in customer experience roles (e.g., Program Manager, Architect), with experience in end-to-end architectural design for hybrid solution landscapes.
* Extensive knowledge of SAP Enterprise Architecture Framework and Toolset, and experience with BTP components and services such as application development, automation, data and analytics, integration, and AI capabilities.
* S/4HANA technical or/and SAP S/4HANA application/functional knowledge/experience.
* Proficiency in SAP Integration and Extensibility Advisory Methodologies and Clean Core principles.
* Excellent communication, influencing, and negotiation skills (in English) at the senior management and C-levels, both within an IT team and across business functions.
* Mindset for Strategic Thinking, Continuous Learning, and Business Acumen.
* Knowledge of on-premise and corresponding SAP cloud solutions.
* Professional training and certification (e.g., SAP Enterprise Architecture Framework featured by LeanIX EAM, SAP Certified Professional-Enterprise Architect [P\_SAPEA\_2023], TOGAF.

  

**Bring out your best**


SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. title: Senior Account Executive, Sweden
description:
**Bring out your best**


SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

  

The Senior Account Executive’s primary responsibilities include prospecting, qualifying, selling, and closing new business to named key customers in Sweden. It is essential that the Senior Account Executive becomes a trusted advisor for the customers and understands how to lead an extended team of experts. He/she needs to be able to demonstrate, how SAP can help the customer reach their desired business outcomes.  

  

If this sounds like something you’d love to do at SAP, please see below for more details, and apply today!  

  

**EXPECTATIONS AND TASKS**  

* Account and Customer Relationship Management
* Achieve / exceed quota targets in Cloud subscription revenue
* Sales strategies - Develops effective and specific account plans to ensure revenue target delivery and sustainable growth.
* Develop relationships in new and existing customers and leverage to drive strategy through organization.
* Trusted advisor - Establishes strong relationships based on knowledge of customer requirements and commitment to value (value of counsel and expertise, value of solutions, value of implementation expertise).
* Builds a foundation on which to harvest future business opportunities and accurate account information and coaching.
* Customer Acumen - Actively understand each customer’s technology footprint, strategic growth plans, technology strategy and competitive landscape.
* Review public information (e.g. new executive appointments, earnings statements, press releases) for the company and its competitors to remain updated on key industry trends and issues impacting the prospect.
* Territory and Account Leadership - Lead designated territory, including accounts, account relationships, prospect profiling, and sales cycles. Encourage all accounts to become SAP references.
* Business Planning – Develop and deliver comprehensive business plan to address customer and prospects priorities and pain points.


  

**Demand Generation, Pipeline and Opportunity Management:**  

* Pipeline planning - Follow a disciplined approach to maintaining a rolling pipeline. Keep pipeline current and moving up the pipeline curve.
* Pipeline partnerships – Leverage support organizations including Marketing, Inside sales, Partners and channels to funnel pipeline into the assigned territory.
* Advance and close sales opportunities - through the successful execution of the sales strategy and roadmap.
* Support all SAP promotions and events in the territory.


  

**WORK EXPERIENCE**  

* 5+ years of experience in selling complex business software / IT solutions
* Strong experience in C-level conversations and negotiations
* Proven track records in business application software sales for Cloud/SaaS solutions.
* Work experience in relevant industry or line of business roles.
* Several years of Large Account Management experience / leading account teams.
* Knowledge of SAPs Service and Support along with understanding of ERP offerings is a plus.
* Demonstrated success with large transactions and lengthy sales campaigns in a fast-paced, consultative and competitive market.
* Outstanding communication and presentation skills in Swedish and English


  

**EDUCATION AND QUALIFICATIONS / SKILLS AND COMPETENCIES**  

* Master’s degree or equivalent in suitable field – business process understanding is needed.
* Exceptional communication skills, able to effectively communicate in every environment, including informing and presenting to CxO level.
* Strategic thinker with high degree of creativity and innovation.
  



**Bring out your best**


SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

 **We win with inclusion**


SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.  

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com  

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

 **EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:**


Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, age, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, et al), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or disability.  

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

title: Labingenjör till växande R&D avdelning
description:
Tog du nyligen examen inom elektronik eller mjukvaraoch vill arbeta med problemlösning? Till en av våra kundersöker nu en nyexaminerad labingenjör med intresse för att arbeta med både praktisk och teoretiskt arbete.Rollen är kopplad till ett talangprogram som ger dig den ultimata övergången mellan studier och arbetsliv.
  
Att jobba som Labingenjör
  
Till vår kund inomR&D, somär en växande avdelning söker vi dig som villarbeta med att säkerställa kvalité och utvecklar kunds produkter genom testning.Teamet består av 14 medarbetare i olika roller som arbetar medolika typer av tester så som accelererade rigg tester och fält-tester.
  
Teamet harmånga olika kontaktytor där de samarbetar med mekanikkonstruktion, elektronik/mjukvara men också produktavdelningar, vilket innebär att du kommer till en social kontext där arbetet varierar.Rollen är av social karaktär där du behöver vara social och tycka om att knyta kontakter med andra.
  
  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter kommer att innefatta:**  

Att föra teoretiska resonemang och arbeta strategiskt kring olika områden
  
Praktiskt arbete i kombination med teori
  
Vara länken mellan produktlabbet och mjukvara/elektronik, förstå både mekanik/elektronik och mjukvara
  
granska och skriva script i Python
  
Besitter kunskaper inom mjukvaruutveckling
  
  

Du kommer till ett prestigelöst gäng som har högt i tak och som också gärna hjälper till och stöttar varandra. Vi har en tung bas inom mekanik i teamet och vi vill nu komplettera med en person som riktar in sig mot elektronik/mjukvara för att vidare säkerställa bästa möjliga upplevelse för våra kunder inom segmentet professionella användare.
  
Rollen är placerad i Jönköping.
  
Att vara konsult på Nexer Tech Talent
  
Nexer Tech Talent är specialister på att ge unga techtalanger den ultimata starten på arbetslivet. För denna roll kommer du att bli anställd av Nexer Tech Talent men arbeta hos kundföretaget, placerat i Jönköping med start omgående.Du kommer även att få ta del av ett skräddarsytt utbildningsprogram där du får möjlighet att utveckla och fördjupa dina tekniska kunskaper i områden som AI, Cloud och cybersäkerhet,men även inom tex. ledarskap och personlig utveckling.
  
Du kommer att coachas av en mentor hos kundföretagetsamt en konsultchef på Nexer Tech Talent. Som konsult hos oss blir du väl omhändertagen och bjuds ofta in på gemensamma aktiviteter så som föreläsningar, afterwork och lunchträffar. Efter framgångsrikt genomförande av konsultuppdraget är intentionen att du erbjuds en anställning hos kund.
  
  

**Vi söker dig som:**  

Är i början av din karriär och har enhögskoleingenjör/civilingenjör inom exempelvis mekatronik, elektronik ellermjukvara
  
Har ett intresse förarbete med både mekanik, elektronik och mjukvara
  
Som person är du ordningsam och är nyfiken på ny teknik
  
Du tycker om att arbeta hands-on i en snabbrörlig miljö
  
Har goda kunskaper i Jira och Python
  
Har flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
  
För denna position behöver du B-körkort
  
Det är meriterande om sitter med egna praktiska projekt på din fritid, såsom mekning eller bygger egnadrönare.
  
  

För denna roll ser vi gärna att du har 0,5 - 1 års arbetslivserfarenhet eller arbetat inom området under din studietid.
  
Ansökan
  
Låter detta som något för dig? Vi arbetar löpande med rekryteringen, så skicka in din ansökan snarast möjligt. Om du har du frågor eller funderingar är du välkommen att kontakta Tech Recruiter Johanna Norman på johanna.norman@nexergroup.com
  
Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig!

title: Data Architect – Infobric Group
description:
Vi är ett av Sveriges största SaaS-bolag somgenom innovativ teknik digitaliserar byggbranschen för att göra den säkrare, mer produktiv och mer hållbar. Hos oss blirdu en del av ett kreativtteam där du får utvecklas, ta dig an spännande utmaningar och samtidigt ha kul på vägen! Vi söker nu fler kollegorsom vill vara med på resan att digitalisera en av världens största branscheroch bidra till ett hållbart samhälle.
  
Är du en erfaren Data Architect som vill vara med och bygga en innovativ och strategiskt viktig dataplattform? Infobric Group söker nu en Data Architect som ska leda arbetet med att samla in, analysera och kombinera data från våra olika affärsområden som en del av vår agenda att bli ännu mer datadrivna i vår uppföljning av verksamheten och vårt beslutsfattande.
  
**Det här kommer du att göra:** Som Data Architect på Infobric Group kommer du att ha en central roll i utvecklingen av vår plattform för datainsamling och dataanalys. Du kommer att arbeta nära våra affärsområden och tekniska team för att säkerställa att vi effektivt kan kombinera data över hela organisationen, vilket är ett av våra viktiga strategiska initiativ. Din uppgift blir att säkerställa att datan används för att driva affärsbeslut och skapa värde för både interna och externa intressenter.
  
  

**Du kommer att:**  

Leda arbetet med att designa och implementera vår dataplattform.
  
Ansvara för att samla och integrera data från våra affärssystem, produkter och övriga stödsystem från våra olika affärsområden till en sammanhängande datainfrastruktur.
  
Arbeta med avancerade dataanalyser och utveckla modeller för att optimera våra affärsprocesser.
  
Vara en nyckelspelare i vår digitaliseringsstrategi och bidra till att etablera datadrivna arbetssätt inom hela organisationen.
  
  

**Vad söker vi hos dig: Vi söker dig som har:**  

Flera års erfarenhet som Data Architect eller liknande roll, med fokus på dataplattformar och analys.
  
Erfarenhet av en eller flera cloud-baserad plattformar så som t ex Snowflake, Google Bigquery, Microsoft Fabric eller liknande.
  
Gedigen kunskap inom dataintegration, datalagring och datahantering.
  
Starka analytiska färdigheter och förmågan att omvandla data till insikter som driver affärsbeslut.
  
Förmåga att samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team och anpassa lösningar efter affärsbehov.
  
  

**Vad vierbjuder:** Som Data Architect på Infobric Group får du möjligheten att vara med och forma framtiden för vår datainfrastruktur och spela en avgörande roll i vår digitaliseringsresa.
  
Du kommer att arbeta nära koncernledningen och resultatet av ditt arbete kommer att ha stor strategisk betydelse för Infobric. Du kommer att vara en del av en lönsam och växande organisation som sätter hållbarhet och innovation i fokus.
  
  

Låter detta som en spännande utmaning för dig? Ansök idag och bli en del av vårt team!
  
Sök enkelt med din LinkedInprofil eller bifoga CV.Vi gör löpande urval ochtjänsten kan komma atttillsättas snabbtså vänta inte med att skicka in din ansökan!

title: Affärsansvarig små och medelstora företag
description:
UNICEF Sverige söker nu en engagerad och resultatinriktad affärsansvarig för små och medelstora företag till vår avdelning för samarbeten med företag, stiftelser och filantropi.


**Om oss**


UNICEF, FN:s barnfond arbetar för att göra barnkonventionen till verklighet för alla barn. Som en av världens ledande barnrättsorganisationer levererar UNICEF i samarbete med partners mer rent vatten, livräddande mat och näring, vaccin, utbildning och skydd från våld än någon annan humanitär organisation. På mandat från FN arbetar UNICEF i 190 länder både i katastrofer och långsiktigt för att säkra barns rättigheter och bygga en bättre framtid.


UNICEF Sverige är en av 32 nationalkommittéer till UNICEF. Vi arbetar med att påverka beslutsfattare och makthavare, sprida kunskap och utbilda samt samla in pengar, för en varaktig förändring och hållbar utveckling för barn - i Sverige och globalt. Vi arbetar i partnerskap med regeringen, regioner och kommuner, myndigheter, näringsliv och civilsamhället. Genom att samverka, påverka och mobilisera resurser skapar vi resultat för och tillsammans med barn och unga.

**Om tjänsten**


I rollen som affärsansvarig för små och medelstora företag kommer du att ha många samarbetsytor och kontaktpunkter såväl inom som utanför organisationen. En viktig del av rollen är att identifiera potentiella samarbeten och affärsutveckla genom att testa dig fram med hjälp av bland annat datadrivna insikter och omvärlds- och trendanalys.


Som affärsansvarig arbetar du för att utöka UNICEFs intäkter från små och medelstora företag för att skapa bästa möjliga förutsättningar för att stärka alla barns rättigheter.


**Arbetsuppgifter**

  

* Bearbeta små och medelstora företag (SME) för att utöka våra intäkter och stärka lojaliteten
* Kontinuerligt skapa kampanjer, digitala utskick och paketeringar
* Arbeta utifrån och testa dig fram via datadrivna insikter
* Samarbeta med övriga avdelningar på UNICEF Sverige, såsom t. ex. vår kommunikations- och vår programavdelning

**Du som person är:**

* Affärsinriktad och resultatinriktad samt brinner för barns rättigheter
* Relationsskapande och kommunikativ
* Analytisk och datadriven
* Vi ser att du har förmåga att komma med nya idéer, vågar testa nytt samt fokusera och prioritera det som du tror ger största möjliga effekt
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av liknande roll
* Erfarenhet av CRM-system såsom t.ex. Salesforce/Marketing Cloud
* Starkt intresse för aktuella frågor inom hållbarhet och näringsliv

**Anställning**


Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning. Startdatum är flexibelt.

**Ansökan:**


Sök redan idag! Vi tillämpar löpande urvalsarbete och uppmanar dig att skicka din ansökan snarast, dock senast den 11 februari 2025. Du skickar in ansökan via vårt rekryteringssystem, ej via mail. Om du har frågor om tjänsten får du gärna kontakta vår Growth Lead Ronnie Schmidt på mail ronnie.schmidt@unicef.se

*För UNICEF Sverige är mångfald en självklarhet och ett naturligt inslag i verksamheten. Medarbetare med olika bakgrund och erfarenheter skapar ökad kreativitet och kvalitet i organisationen. Därför beaktas alltid mångfaldhetsaspekten vid urval till nya rekryteringar.* *I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av anonymisering i första rekryteringssteget, vilket innebär att vi inte ser kandidaternas identitetsuppgifter förrän vi ev önskar kalla dessa på intervju.*

*UNICEF Sverige arbetar med aktivt medarbetarskap. Det går ut på att skapa en organisation och en företagskultur där medarbetarna kan ta initiativ och agera på ett självständigt sätt.*

*UNICEF Sveriges ledarskap är värderingsbaserat med ett coachande förhållningssätt, vilket lägger grunden för ett starkt engagemang, som i sin tur leder till ett bättre resultat. Våra medarbetare efterfrågar ett högre syfte och mening med sitt arbete och vill att det stämmer överens med deras egna värderingar. Hos oss är organisationskulturen mycket viktig och vi arbetar därför aktivt med den. UNICEF Sverige har enats kring tre värdeord som ska prägla samspelet mellan medarbetare, chefer och externa kontakter; professionalism, mod och handlingskraft.*
company_addresses:
