New York NY, United States 10017
company_description: At UNICEF, we are committed, passionate and proud of what we do. Promoting the rights of every child isn’t just a job – it’s a calling.

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Are you ready to be a key contributor within the Data & Analytics Engineering department at NOBA Bank Group? Your focus will be on advancing analytics capabilities, optimizing data workflows, driving innovation in the cloud, and unlocking the full potential of the organization’s most valuable asset – data.  

  

**About the role:**

  

The Data & Analytics Engineering department comprises specialized teams focused on Data Infrastructure Engineering, Analytics Engineering, and Data Management.


As a Data Analytics Engineer, you'll play a central role in building and optimizing the organization's supporting analytics layer, collaborating across the bank. This role offers broad opportunities to grow and make a tangible impact!


We offer a hybrid working model with two common in-office days. While we value flexibility, we also prioritize collaboration, team-building, and enjoying fikas and after-work gatherings together!

 **Main tasks:**

  

* Design and implement efficient data models, focusing on analytics workflows and end-user usability.
* Build robust and scalable data pipelines to support business intelligence and analytics needs.
* Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders, such as Risk, Finance, and IT, to ensure data solutions align with business needs.
* Ensure data quality, security, and compliance throughout the analytics lifecycle.
* Drive technical improvements, introducing modern tools and processes to enhance analytics capabilities.

Partner with other engineers to align transformation processes for analytics purposes.  
* 

**We are looking for someone who:**

  

Enjoys working with analytics, modern data practices, and creating insights that drive decisions. We believe you are a detail-oriented and proactive person who thrives in a collaborative environment and enjoy learning new technologies. You approach challenges with a “can-do” attitude and excel in analytical thinking and problem-solving. For this role you’ll need:

* Work experience in a similar role within data, analytics, or software development.
* An academic degree related to analytics engineering, data engineering, or similar fields.
* Proficiency in ETL processes, designing analytics-ready datasets, and ensuring clean and usable data for stakeholders.
* Proficiency in Databricks, dbt (SQL), and related reporting tools.
* Experience with Power BI or similar BI tools.
* Strong English skills, with a good understanding of Swedish and/or Norwegian.

**It’s a plus if you have:**

* Experience with Microsoft’s data stack (Azure, SQL, and other cloud services).
* A background in data roles within the financial sector.

Knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies.  
* 

**Our offer to you:**

* Freedom with Responsibility: Flexible working arrangements to suit your work style.
* Career Development: Opportunities to grow and develop in your role.
* Feedback Culture: A supportive environment that encourages open communication.
* Coaching Leadership: Managers who guide and support your career journey.
* A Caring Company Culture: We genuinely care about each other!


In addition to this, it is important to us that you recognize yourself in our values: **we are wholehearted, we collaborate and we take the lead.**


**Practical information:**  

Start: By agreement  

Location: Stockholm or Oslo  

Form of employment: Permanent employment (6-month probationary period)  

Working hours: 08:30-17:00 (June-August: 08:30-16:00)

 **Have you heard of NOBAVERSE?**


In our NOBAVERSE, we value openness, trust, and diversity. Here, you can influence your own development and have fun along the way to achieving our goals – all in a workplace that’s a little extra *bubbly*!


Read more about our employee value proposition on our careers page.

  

We strive for diversity of knowledge and experiences among our employees and welcome all applicants who are qualified for the position. We are committed to a recruitment process free from discrimination that provides equal opportunities for all.  

  

**What happens when you have submitted your application?**  

  

The number of steps in the recruitment process may vary depending on the position you are applying for, but we always try to keep the process as short and concise as possible, to protect your application experience. You can read more about how our recruitment process works in the FAQ.



If you have any questions or concerns about the position, please contact the responsible recruiter Sarah Wahlstedt Corméry at sarah.wahlstedt.cormery@nordax.se .


We look forward to receiving your application!
  

  

*NOBA Bank protects your privacy and, with reference to the GDPR, would like to ask you not to include any sensitive personal data in your application. Examples of sensitive personal data can be information about ethnic origin, political opinions, religious beliefs or information about your health, such as sick leave. If you have protected personal information, please inform the responsible recruiter so that we can handle your personal data correctly.*

title: Platform Specialist
description:
**About** **Redeploy Run**  

  

At Redeploy Run, we specialize in platform engineering and operations, helping our customers simplify their infrastructure and speed up application delivery. Our mission is to make cloud adoption faster and easier.  

  

Our 'Ready-to-Run' platform products, including Technology Platforms and Industry Cloud Platforms, let IT departments and developers manage infrastructure and governance with ease. Leveraging Infrastructure as Code, container-based services, CI/CD, and Kubernetes, and collaborating with cloud providers like Azure and AWS, we tackle complex problems, enhance our tools, and provide guidance to help customers get the most of their cloud platforms. Learn more about us here.  

  

As a rapidly growing cloud company, we understand that our success depends on the talents we choose to surround ourselves with. Now we are looking for our next Platform Specialist in Stockholm who wants to be a part of our continued success story. Maybe it's you?  

  

**What it means to be a Platform Specialist at Redeploy Run**  

  

As a Platform Specialist, you'll join Redeploy Run’s Product team, focusing on operations as well as developing and refining our Ready-to-Run Cloud and Technology platform products for our customers in the Nordics. We're steadily implementing and onboarding new customers and are continuously improving our offerings. With increasing demand for our services, we now need to strengthen our team.  

  

In this role, your mission will be to help clients unlock the full potential of their Azure and AWS infrastructure environments and further develop our products with your Product team colleagues.  

  

**Some of your tasks will amongst others be:**

* Work on consultant assignments such as architectural advice and implementations.
* Building platform services within cloud infrastructure.
* Support our clients with onboarding of our platform services.
  

  

**Who are you?**  

  

We believe you have a passion for cloud development and enjoy creating value and solving problems for clients. In this client-facing role, you’re proactive in proposing solutions and suggestions to improve client environments, seeing opportunities and potential for enhancements. You’re open-minded, positive, driven, and curious, with a strong belief in team collaboration and knowledge sharing.

 **What experiences do you bring?**

* Customer-centric mindset with the ability to efficiently handle several cases and activities from multiple customers simultaneously.
* Ability to understand customers’ problems and develop effective solutions, while also identifying new opportunities to provide additional value.
* Deep knowledge in infrastructure technologies, including cloud computing (Azure and AWS), networking, security, and AI solutions.
* Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code using Terraform and development and management of CI/CD pipelines through GitHub Actions.
* Programming/scripting with Python, Go, Bash or similar.
* Great communication skills, both verbal and written in Swedish and English.
  

  

**And if you come with below experiences, we see it as a great advantage**

* Certifications in Azure and AWS.
* Container orchestration using Kubernetes.
* Experience working with Go microservices.
* Experience with developer platform products such as Backstage or similar.
  

*Even if you* don’t perfectly match the role, we still encourage you to apply. We believe in diversity and inclusion and welcome all applicants with relevant experience and skills.

  

**What we offer**  

  

Being a member of Redeploy means you have the drive and desire to be the best and work smarter than the rest. We enjoy creative freedom with our projects, benefit from great work/life balance, and thrive in a company culture that is both collaborative and supportive. Everything we do at Redeploy is centered around the simple yet effective idea that we all chip in to ensure our success.  

  

To learn more about our benefits, scroll down

  

**Location**  

  

We have offices located in central Stockholm at Torsgatan 4. As we encourage a mix of in-person and remote work to foster innovation and support work-life balance (and like to have fun together), we see that you are based in commuting distance to our office location and that you are happy to come into the office a few times a week.

  

**How to apply**  

  

We hope that we have sparked your interest and that you are curious to know more about the role and us at Redeploy.  

  

We are constantly recruiting, so submit your application as soon as you can by hitting the apply button. To be compliant with GDPR, we only accept applications through our careers channel. Please submit your application using the form on our career website, or any website displaying a position with us.  

  

For any specific questions about the position, reach out to Talent Acquisition Manager Francisca Andersson.  

  

We look forward hearing from you!

title: Enterprise Architect/Domain Architect
description:
#### **Assignment description**


Our client is seeking an experienced Enterprise Architect/Domain Architect for an assignment of approximately 8 months, with potential for extension. This role is central to driving and developing the organization's IT architecture and requires an individual with broad technical competence and excellent communication skills. A few examples of Key Responsibilities Design and implement IT architecture solutions within the enterprise architecture domain. Develop data models for system integration. Analyze and present pros and cons of various technical solutions, including on-premise and cloud-based alternatives. Effectively communicate technical concepts and solutions to various stakeholders within the organization. Create comprehensive technical documentation. Work hands-on with architecture development and implementation. Tasks Design and implement enterprise architecture solutions. Create data models for system integration. Evaluate and recommend technical solutions based on organizational needs. Collaborate with various departments to ensure IT architecture supports business goals. Present architecture proposals and technical solutions to management and stakeholders. Produce detailed technical documentation. Participate in and lead architecture-related projects.

#### **Must haves**


Qualifications Solid background in software development. In-depth understanding of enterprise architecture and domain architecture. Experience with Microsoft environments. Ability to work independently and take responsibility for documentation and presentations. Excellent communication skills in English, both written and verbal. Experience working in cross-functional teams. Desirable Qualities Driven and proactive work style. Analytical ability to evaluate different technical solutions. Ability to see the big picture and understand how different systems and domains interact. Flexibility to adapt to various technical challenges. Strong presentation skills to effectively communicate with different stakeholders.

#### **Other requirements**


Work Environment Workplace: 100% on-site in Lund. Assignment length: Initially 8 months with possibility of extension. Language: Fluent English required.

title: Technical Lead - Infotainment Software
description:
**The opportunity**


We're currently looking for a Technical Lead. Someone to join our Infotainment Software team in order to develop high-end infotainment systems. Someone with a passion for electric mobility, an interest in technology, and a desire to create the change we know is needed.


Infotainment Software team is a part of Connected Experience group in R&D and consists of specialists with broad expertise in Android Automotive OS. Currently the team is focused on development of a high-end infotainment system for the latest model of Polestar, which is not yet on the market. We’re committed to fostering our professional development with continuous learning, mentorship, and access to advanced tools and technologies.


This position is located in Gothenburg, Sweden.  



  

**The responsibilities**


As a Technical Lead in the Infotainment Software team, you will play a key role in designing, developing, and deploying next-generation infotainment systems. You will leverage your expertise in AOSP, AAOS, Vehicle HAL (VHAL), AIDL, and communication protocols such as FlexRay, SomeIP, and IPCP to lead a team of developers in delivering high-quality software solutions. This position demands strong technical leadership, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.


See below for a more thorough breakdown of the various tasks and areas you'll be responsible for:


* Lead the design, development, and implementation of advanced infotainment software solutions based on AOSP and AAOS.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, system architects, and product managers, to define software requirements and architecture.
* Develop and maintain Vehicle HAL (VHAL) and AIDL interfaces for seamless communication between hardware and software layers.
* Ensure efficient handling of automotive signals and data communication over protocols such as FlexRay, SomeIP, and IPCP.
* Mentor and guide a team of software engineers, fostering a culture of technical excellence and innovation.
* Perform code reviews, enforce coding standards, and ensure software quality and performance.
* Drive debugging, troubleshooting, and root cause analysis for complex system-level issues.
* Stay updated with the latest trends and technologies in automotive software and provide strategic input to enhance product offerings.
* Collaborate with external stakeholders and vendors to ensure seamless integration of third-party components and services.

  

**The ideal candidate**


In order to succeed in this role, and at Polestar in general, there are a few characteristics you'll need to have. Tenacity. Flexibility. Curiosity. The ability to take the initiative, to meet deadlines and requirements, and to abandon ideas when they're not feasible.


Our ideal candidate excels at identifying challenges and devising effective solutions, demonstrating excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to make sound technical decisions under pressure. You should possess strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with diverse teams.


In addition, you'll need the following qualifications/experience:


* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
* Experience in software development, with proven experience in a technical leadership role.
* Expertise in AOSP and AAOS development, including system-level customization and application development.
* In-depth knowledge of Vehicle HAL (VHAL), AIDL.
* Experience with automotive communication protocols such as FlexRay, SomeIP, and IPCP.
* Proficient in C++, Java, Kotlin, and Python with a strong understanding of software design principles.
* Experience with build systems (e.g., Bazel, Gradle) and version control systems (e.g., Git).
* Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.


Preferred experience:

* Experience with integrating cloud-based services and OTA (Over-the-Air) updates in automotive systems.
* Knowledge of cybersecurity standards and practices in the automotive domain.
* Familiarity with diagnostic tools and frameworks such as DLT, CANoe, or Wireshark.


Polestar is an international company, with various backgrounds represented. English, therefore, is the language of written and spoken communication. And though we have a global presence, we maintain the growth-mindset. Change happens often at Polestar. But so does progress. Expect an accelerating, exciting environment.


**The process**


If the above matches your ambitions, be sure to apply. The advert will initially close to new applications on 4th February 2025.


The Polestar journey is an electric one.

title: People Business Partner
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity:**


Business Area Networks (BNEW) R&D enables Ericsson’s technology leadership by leading the shift to becoming a leader in open programmable networks. To maintain our leadership and continue our 5G success story, we will lead the shift towards open programmable cloud-native networks with the best performance, security, and energy efficiency at the lowest TCO (total cost of ownership).

  

The People team supporting BNEW R&D provides advice and support to our leaders to ensure that we have the right workforce today and tomorrow to execute on our business strategy. We are now seeking a dynamic individual to join our People team as Networks R&D People Business Partner.

 **What you will do:**


We are now seeking a dynamic individual to join our People team as Networks R&D People Business Partner. In this role you will wear multiple hats, working at different times as a consultant, advisor, problem solver, and doer. You will work closely with leaders to address a wide range of people-related topics opportunities, driving key initiatives across the Networks R&D three Engineering Units (Hardware, Integrated RAN and Cloud RAN) & T&S.

 **The skills you bring:**


As this role is based in Sweden we expect experience from roles such as HR Business Partner from the Swedish market.

 **Relevant work experience:**

* Experience in either People Function, Business Administration or other multidisciplinary field supporting global units
* Collaboration and team working skills
* Proven track record of developing solutions to varied people challenges and opportunities, addressing root-causes rather than symptoms
* Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
* Data analytics including strong excel skills
* Project management.

 **Behaviours and preferred ways of working:**

* Collaborate by default & working across Networks R&D to bring to life a consistent People Experience (PX)
* Strong interest in our business & people at heart, and in designing solutions in collaboration with business leaders and their strategic priorities at heart
* Agility in being able to quickly adapt to changing priorities and reprioritise when necessary
* Project management & the ability to bring structure to multifaceted processes and initiatives
* A passion for adopting data driven approach where causal analytics drive solutions rather than relying only on precedent, theory or gut feel
* An openness to experiment, try, fail & learn quickly, and challenge dominant logic and the “traditional way People Function support the business”
* Comfort with new and different priorities quickly appearing and needing to be addressed
* Growth mindset and continuous learner not afraid to try new approaches, fail fast and learn
**Application**  

We look forward to your application with CV/Resume in English.  

Last day to apply: 5th of February 2025  

Location: Stockholm, Sweden

  

Please note that we do not accept, process, or respond to applications sent via e-mail.

  

If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Nina Juthage, Sr. Recruiter, at nina.a.juthage@ericsson.com

 **Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**  

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.

  

Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we nurture it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.

  



If you need assistance or to request an accommodation due to a disability, please contact Ericsson at hr.direct.mana@ericsson.com

  

DISCLAIMER: The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees in this position. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required for this position, and you may be required to perform additional job tasks as assigned.

title: Radio Project Manager
description:
**Grow with us**
----------------


**About this opportunity:**

  

Standards & Technology unit within Business Area Networks drives technology foresight for the complete business area portfolio, from antennas to cloud! We are close to 300 researchers and developers present at four main sites in Kista, Lund, Paris, and Rosenheim. What makes us unique is that within our unit we have competences in all areas needed to both research and build state-of-the-art mobile networks, putting research results into practice.


You will be part of Standards & Technology’s Radios & Antennas team researching, developing, and validating the latest state-of-the-art radio technologies ranging from lower physical layers through signal to the antenna. Concept development, design and validation is done in everything from our ground-breaking simulators and crude lab prototypes to end-to-end systems implemented in product-like prototypes. You will be working in one of the most experienced teams within this domain in the world.


We are now looking for a Radio project manager wanting to take on a broad role in the drive of our 6G and beyond radio development & research projects.

 **What you will do:**

  

* Lead Radio development projects of all kinds and sizes, ranging from research ideas to full design, manufacturing, integration, and certification of product-like prototypes. This includes driving project scope definition, effort estimates, time planning, resource assessments, follow-ups, and reporting.
* Engage in all project management aspects, anywhere from high-level, long-term strategic planning down to technical details in engineers’ daily work.
* Drive efficient communication and coordination with stakeholders and adjacent development projects such as baseband and trials.
* Drive Radio technical leadership: Understand industry trends and customer benefits.
* Promote S&T Radio technology: Engage in Ericsson activities with customers , supplier and partners

 **The skills you bring:**

  

* MSc or PhD degree in electrical engineering, telecommunications or similar
* Strong track-record in technical leadership roles
* Ability to organize and lead multi-disciplinary teams
* Understanding of radio-related technical disciplines such as mechanics, thermal, PCB, RF, FPGA, digital design, control software, antennas, analog front-end, converters, radio system, radio algorithms, beamforming, e.t.c.
* Responsiveness and self-sufficiency
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills
* Fluency in English mandatory, proficiency in Swedish is an advantage
**Last date to apply: 5th Feb 2025**

At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.

Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

title: Technical Program Manager
description:
**Job description:** 




 HCL Tech is looking for a skilled Technical Program Manager for our team in Stockholm. The ideal candidate will play a pivotal role in spearheading end-to-end execution of client projects according to HCL Tech and client expectations.
 



  





 We're looking for a TPM who can be responsible for providing project planning and management for established initiatives within a company. Ensure that projects are completed to specification, within an established time frame and budget. Act as a lead subject matter expert within the company regarding technology concerns. We want you if you're a versatile person, display individual leadership, and are enthusiastic to get to work every day and tackle new problems.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 
 :
 


* Be a hands on leader by guiding the team to develop and maintain program plans, identify resource needs, and balance project schedules; lead strategy with other program team members and partners on progress, dependencies and risks.
* Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure the effectiveness of key initiatives.
* Mentor and train junior consultants, fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous learning within the team.
* Proactively communicate with clients, including Weekly/Monthly project status, resource needs, and how to maximize results.
* Coordinate collaboration of the team members assigned to the project ,and various client stakeholders in relationship to the scope and timeline.
* Manage schedules and deliverables, ensuring projects stay on track and within scope.
* Organize and document internal and external meetings, including agendas, schedules, meeting notes, and recordings.
* Establish and maintain project documentation, including schedule status, stakeholder changes, client feedback, and resources.
* Provide clear and concise updates to the team regarding project status during weekly production meetings.
* Anticipate and analyze potential risks and communicate promptly to the stakeholders.
* Look for opportunities within projects for additional engagements and where clients will benefit from value centric ideas
* Review code developed by other developers and provide feedback to ensure best practices (e.g., style guidelines, checking code in, accuracy, testability, and efficiency).
* Contribute to existing documentation or educational content and adapt content based on product/program updates and user feedback.



  





**Minimum qualifications:** 



* Bachelor's/Master's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* Minimum 5+ years of relevant work experience in program management.
* Minimum 5+ years as a people manager.
* Experience in coding with Python and/or C++.
* Experience in data structures or algorithms.
* Excellent problem solving skills.
* Experience with Artificial Intelligence (AI) tools and technologies.
* Strategic thinker with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing diverse challenges.
* Excellent verbal, written, and facilitation skills (including experience with facilitating meetings and engaging with an executive audience).
* Demonstrated experience and success leading high-impact, cross-functional programs or products.
* Possesses flexibility and has a history of delivering impactful, scalable programs.
* Ability to accelerate deliverables through taking calculated risks and experimenting with new solutions.



  





**Preferred qualifications:** 



* Experience in Video/Audio processing would be an advantage.

title: Security Engineer
description:
Requirements -
 



  





 Cloud Expertise
 


* Deep understanding of AWS, Azure, and GCP security services (IAM, security groups, firewalls, encryption, key management, etc.).
* Familiarity with multi-cloud security frameworks and management tools.



 Security Knowledge
 


* Strong knowledge of cloud security frameworks and standards (e.g CIS Benchmarks, NIS2, ISO 27001).
* Experience implementing identity and access management (IAM) and zero-trust architectures.
* Proficiency in encryption, data protection, and secure network design.



 Compliance and Regulatory
 


* Expertise in translating compliance frameworks into cloud security controls.

 Automation and DevSecOps
 


* Experience in integrating security into CI/CD pipelines using tools like Terraform, Ansible, or cloud-native tools.

 Soft Skills
 


* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Excellent communication and ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Project management skills to drive security initiatives across multiple teams.

title: Customer Relationship Management Consultant
description:
**Om rollen** 




**Leadfront växer snabbt, och vi söker nu certifierade Salesforce Sales & Service Cloud-konsulter** 
 som vill bli en del av vårt engagerade team! Hos oss får du möjlighet att arbeta med strategiska och operativa CRM-projekt, med fokus på att designa, implementera och optimera Salesforce-lösningar för våra kunder. Vi samarbetar med framstående företag som använder Salesforce globalt för att integrera sina CX-processer och maximera affärsnyttan.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 




**Som Salesforce Sales & Service Cloud-konsult på Leadfront kommer du att:** 



* **Genomföra förstudier och analysarbete:** 
 Samarbeta med säljteamet för att skapa kundanpassade lösningar och strategier.
* **Utforska kundens affärsbehov:** 
 Föreslå Salesforce-åtgärder som stärker deras affärsprocesser och skapar mätbart värde.
* **Dela din expertis:** 
 Ge råd om Salesforce Sales och Service Cloud bästa praxis och tekniska lösningar, både internt och till kund.
* **Utveckla strategier:** 
 Implementera både kort- och långsiktiga Salesforce-lösningar som integreras med kundens övriga affärssystem.
* **Planera och leda Salesforce-migreringsprojekt:** 
 Säkerställa smidiga dataöverföringar och implementeringar.
* **Stärka Salesforce-användning:** 
 Inspirera och utbilda kunder i hur Salesforce kan användas strategiskt för att uppnå deras affärsmål.
* **Utveckla produktkartor:** 
 Bidra till en långsiktig roadmap för att hålla kunderna i framkant med Salesforce-innovationer.



  





**Din bakgrund** 




 Vi söker dig som är certifierad inom Salesforce och har erfarenhet av att arbeta både strategiskt och operativt med Salesforce Sales och Service Cloud. Du kombinerar teknisk kompetens med affärsmässig förståelse och har en passion för att skapa värde för kunder.
 



**Vi ser gärna att du har:** 



* **Certifiering inom Salesforce Sales Cloud och/eller Service Cloud (KRAV).**
* **Minst 2 års erfarenhet av Salesforce-projekt, gärna inom komplexa miljöer.**
* **Erfarenhet av affärsutveckling och kundkontakt.**
* **Ett naturligt intresse för teknik, data och analys.**
* **En allmän teknikvana och en vilja att delta i tekniska projekt** 
 som rör lösningar utanför Salesforce-plattformen.
* **Mod och nyfikenhet att ta dig an nya projekt och lösningar** 
 , även inom områden där du inte har tidigare erfarenhet.
* **Erfarenhet av att leda transformationsprojekt** 
 , gärna med fokus på Salesforce och integration med andra system.



  





**Hos Leadfront får du en dynamisk roll med fokus på utveckling och innovation, där du ingår i ett team av engagerade Salesforce-specialister. Vi erbjuder en fast ersättning** 
 , oberoende av beläggning, och en arbetsmiljö där du har stor frihet under ansvar.
 



 Vi erbjuder också:
 


* Centralt kontor i Stockholm.
* Daglig frukost för att börja dagen rätt.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr/år.
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring och tjänstepension.
* Spännande uppdrag hos kunder som Klarna, DNB, Tieto och Telenor.
* Centralt kontor i Stockholm.
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr/år.
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring och tjänstepension.
* Spännande uppdrag hos kunder som Klarna, DNB, Tieto och Telenor.
* Ett jämt fördelat team med 50 % tjejer och killar från olika bakgrunder.
* En inkluderande företagskultur med högt i tak ich där alla röster räknas.

title: IT Support
description:
**Job Description**
 Working at Coherent, there's a lot to be said for it! Coherent is the world's largest laser company. More than 27,000 employees in over 40 countries work on leading photonics solutions for industrial, scientific and medical applications. The best talents in this field are now working hand in hand on pioneering technologies that set the standards in the market. In addition to many benefits for customers, there are also very attractive prospects for personal and professional development for every employee - in a technically exciting environment. A very collegial atmosphere, professionalism and international cooperation characterize the working atmosphere.
   

  

**Primary Duties & Responsibilities**
* Provide user support, including remote and on-site assistance, for PC systems in back-office and production environments.
* Handle service requests, fault reports, and orders through a ticket system (FreshService).
* Install and administer hardware and software (manual, SCCM- and Autopilot-based).
* Collaborate with colleagues locally and internationally, including teams in Germany, Europe, and the USA.
* Contribute to local and global IT projects, ensuring high-quality service delivery and customer satisfaction.
* Coordinate and oversee external service providers.
* Train employees and conduct user training sessions.
* Manage independent projects and participate in cross-departmental project groups.


**Requirements**
 We believe the ideal candidate has prior experience in a similar environment, preferably within the
 **industrial or manufacturing sector** 
 . At Coherent; professionalism, a collegial atmosphere, and international cooperation define our culture.
   

  

**Qualifications & Experience**
* Proven experience in a similar role, ideally within the industrial or manufacturing sector.
* Solid knowledge of Microsoft Cloud infrastructures (Office 365, OneDrive, Teams).
* Familiarity with ITIL frameworks, with both theoretical and practical applications being advantageous.
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.


**Languages Required:** 
 Proficiency in both English and Swedish
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A technically stimulating environment with opportunities for growth and development.
* A supportive, professional, and international workplace culture.


 If you are a motivated IT specialist who thrives in a collaborative, innovative, and dynamic setting, we encourage you to apply and join our team in
 **Järfälla** 
 .
   

  

**About Us**
 Coherent is a global leader in lasers, engineered materials and networking components. We are a vertically integrated manufacturing company that develops innovative products for diversified applications in the industrial, optical communications, military, life sciences, semiconductor equipment, and consumer markets. Coherent provides a comprehensive career development platform within an environment that challenges employees to perform at their best, while rewarding excellence and hard-work through a competitive compensation program. It's an exciting opportunity to work for a company that offers stability, longevity and growth. Come Join Us!
   

  

**Note to recruiters and employment agencies:** 
 We will not pay for unsolicited resumes from recruiters and employment agencies unless we have a signed agreement and have required assistance, in writing, for a specific opening.

title: Solution Engineer
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Software Development
description:
At Infobip, we dream big. We value creativity, persistence, and innovation, passionately believing that it is through teamwork that we can all reach greater heights.
   

  

 Since 2006, we have been innovating at the edge of technological possibilities and are now shaping global communications of the future. Through 75+ offices on six continents, Infobip’s platform is used by almost 80% of the population, making it the largest network of its kind and the only full-stack cloud communication platform globally.
   

  

 Join us on our mission to create life-changing interactions between humans and online services with new and unseen solutions.
   

  

 Why is this role important at Infobip?
   

  

 Our
 *Solution Engineer* 
 is a mediator between Infobip and customer deployers/development technical teams, providing accurate technical solutions and expertise. The role takes part in activities for Infobip’s customers, product proposals, deployments, connectivity & integrations, implementations, solution design, and delivery. In order to deliver the desired business results, you will collaborate with the regional teams and serve as a project manager or assist the more experienced project leads.
   

  

 You’ll have the opportunity to learn about Infobip’s products and solutions as well as our company’s business processes. With your project management experience, you successfully perform project-related tasks and consult with Product Development teams, Solutions Engineers, our Solution Architect, and Solution Managers on assigned projects.
   

  

 You know you are doing a good job when you:
   

  

* Have a strong knowledge of all technical aspects of Infobip’s products and solutions.
* Understand the customers’ businesses, knowing exactly which of our products can help them evolve their business.
* Integrate Infobip products into our clients’ systems (custom-scripted API, SFTP, and other solutions over CPaaS and SaaS services).
* Can identify new and innovative use cases for Infobip’s products and solutions.
* Have an excellent understanding of the business and are up to date with the latest industry trends as well as the competition.
* Can build a solid relationship with our sales and technical teams so they consider you an asset and enjoy working with you.
* Conduct demos, Proof of Concepts (POCs), and solution integration enablement sessions for customers and summarize meetings via documentation.
* Maintain the highest degree of customer satisfaction during project implementation.
* Collect the technical requirements and design technical solutions and service integration plans.
* Deliver detailed and accurate technical documentation.
* Handle technical and security questionnaires.
* Ensure that all the projects are delivered on time, within scope and budget.


**More About You & Qualifications**
* Minimum 4 to 6 years of strong, related experience that has developed your expertise in pre-sales, tech sales, system integrations, or similar roles.
* Experience in a technical role in the Telecommunications industry / CPaaS space.
* Fluent in Swedish and English
* Preferred knowledge in virtualization, machine learning, RCS, and mobile identity solutions.
* Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) to clients, partners, and colleagues.
* You have the ability to challenge the status quo.
* You have an Engineering background and passion for IT and technology.
* Proactive and creative approach to attend to clients’ needs (even if sometimes they’re not aware of those needs).
* Able to present products and ideas with ease, confidence, and persistence.
* Project management experience is a must.
* Thrives in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.


*Infobip employees are people with diverse backgrounds, characteristics, and experiences that share the same passion and talent that helps us achieve our mission. That's why Infobip is committed to creating a diverse workplace and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer.*
*All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, veteran status, or any other part of one's identity.*

description:

 As a Solution Architect, you will have a central role in shaping modern and business-critical systems. You work closely with customers to understand their needs and transform these into technical solutions that are both sustainable and scalable. With a focus on .NET, C#, ASP.NET MVC, Entity Framework, React, JavaScript, and cloud services such as Azure and AWS, you will design and develop solutions that meet both current and future requirements. Your expertise and dedication will be critical to driving projects forward and creating real value for clients.
 



  





**They are looking for someone who:** 




 - Have at least 5 years of experience in .NET development and system architecture.
 



 - Is used to leading technical discussions and proposing solutions.
 



 - Enjoys the consultant role and likes to work closely with customers.
 



 - Fluent in Swedish and English.Wants to support and inspire colleagues as a mentor.
 



  





**What they offer:** 




 - A flexible workplace in central Stockholm.
 



 - Opportunity to influence projects that make a difference for both customers and society.
 



 - An open and inclusive company culture that values your development.
 



 - Opportunity to be part of a large code department with a mix of junior and senior developers as well as solution architects.

 You will get to work with technology at the forefront together with committed colleagues. Our clients offer exciting and varied assignments where you can influence projects that make a difference in society. title: Technical Support Specialist
description:
**Are you ready to be part of something exciting?** 




 We’re looking for a
 **Technical Support Specialist** 
 to join our team at Startdeliver, the next-generation platform for Customer Success. If you're technically inclined, eager to learn, and looking for a role where you can grow and take on new responsibilities, keep reading!
 



  





**Who we are** 




 Startdeliver is revolutionizing the way businesses deliver value to their customers. Using AI-powered tools, we help companies make sense of customer data and turn insights into actions. Our mission? To empower organizations to do the right things for their customers at the right time, driving meaningful impact.
 



  





**What you’ll do** 




 As a
 **Technical Support Specialist** 
 , you’ll be the go-to person for technical support, ensuring our customers get the most out of our platform. While you don’t need to be a developer, familiarity with APIs, JSON, and related tools—as well as an eagerness to tackle technical challenges—are key.
 



  





 Your key responsibilities will include:
 


* **Supporting our customers** 
 – Troubleshoot technical issues and answer questions to ensure a smooth experience with Startdeliver.
* **Working with data** 
 – Assist customers with data integration using JSON and other relevant tools.
* **Collaborating across teams** 
 – Work closely with Product and Customer Success to address customer needs and provide feedback for product improvements.
* **Documenting and improving processes** 
 – Create resources and guides to help customers self-serve and streamline support operations.
* **Growing with us** 
 – Dive into learning opportunities, take on new challenges, and expand your skill set in a fast-growing company.



  





**What we’re looking for** 




 To thrive in this role, you should have:
 



 ✔
 **Strong technical aptitude** 
 and a willingness to learn (experience with APIs is necessary).
 



 ✔
 **Problem-solving skills** 
 and a customer-first mindset.
 



 ✔
 **Great communication skills** 
 – You’ll be explaining complex concepts in simple terms.
 



 ✔
 **A proactive approach** 
 to improving processes and finding better ways to serve our customers.
 



  





 💡
 **Bonus points if you have** 
 experience in SaaS, startups, or a support/customer success role.
 



**What makes this role different?** 




 🚀
 **Growth opportunities** 
 – This isn’t just a support role. You’ll have the chance to develop into areas like product development, customer success and much more!
 



 🧠
 **Work with cutting-edge technology** 
 – We’re integrating AI into our platform and support processes, giving you hands-on experience with the latest innovations.
 



 🤝
 **Collaborative culture** 
 – Your ideas matter. You’ll work with a team that values creativity, ownership, and having fun while doing impactful work.
 



  





**Ready to join?** 




 If you’re passionate about customer success, eager to develop your technical skills, and want to be part of a fast-growing company, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





 📩
 **Apply today and help us shape the future of Customer Success!**

title: Exchange Online Level 3 Subject Matter Expert
description:
**Exchange Online Level 3 - Subject Matter Expert** 




**Location: Stockholm Sweden** 




**Mode of Employment: Contract** 




  





**Job Description:** 




**Key Responsibilities** 
 :
 


* Lead and manage the transition of Exchange Online environments, ensuring minimal disruption to operations.
* Develop and implement PowerShell scripts for heavy automation of Exchange Online tasks and processes.
* Provide Level 3 support for troubleshooting and resolving complex issues related to Exchange Online.

* Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation for Exchange Online configurations, scripts, and processes.

* Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.

title: Kronos Workforce Management Consultant
description:
Key Requirements:
 


1. UKG Pro (Dimensions) Deployment Experience:


* At least one global successful deployment of UKG Pro (formerly Dimensions).
* Minimum of 3 global deployments in Kronos cloud systems (preferably UKG Pro).


1. Experience:


* 10+ years of experience in global Kronos cloud deployments.
* 15+ years of expertise in Workforce Management (WFM), which includes end-to-end processes like:
* Pre-scheduling
* Scheduling
* Timekeeping
* Integration with payroll systems


1. Techno-Functional Experience:


* The role requires Techno-functional expertise, suggesting a blend of both technical knowledge and functional business skills.
* Ideal for someone with Tech Architect-level experience to oversee complex deployments and ensure smooth integration and configuration.


1. Multiple Country Deployments:


* The consultant will manage multiple country deployments, likely 6-7 countries per individual.
* Must be senior enough to support and guide technical teams.


1. Location Flexibility:


* While based in Stockholm, Sweden, the location is flexible. The priority is finding someone with the right skills and experience.



 Skills Needed:
 


* Technical:
* Deep technical knowledge of Kronos (UKG Pro) cloud deployment.
* Ability to integrate WFM systems with payroll and other enterprise systems.
* Functional:
* Strong understanding of the entire WFM domain (including scheduling, timekeeping, payroll).
* Experience in global deployments, handling configurations and supporting country-specific needs.



 Key Competencies:
 


* Kronos Workforce Management Technical expertise.
* Proven ability to manage large-scale, multi-country deployments.
* Experience working as a Tech Architect is a plus.



 Important Considerations:
 


* The role requires a consultant with senior-level experience, who is capable of leading and supporting teams for complex, multi-country deployments.
* The position is located in Stockholm, but flexibility in location is available as long as the consultant possesses the necessary competencies.

title: Systems Engineer-Scandinavia
description:
**Join Extreme Networks, a leading provider of cloud-managed networking solutions.**
 We're seeking a talented Systems Engineer to join our dynamic team to work in Scandinavia and to contribute our mission of simplifying and securing the access network.
   

  

 There has never been a better time to join Extreme Networks, with several acquisitions extending our portfolio and go to market strategy, we have seen enormous opportunity and growth within the region.
   

  

 Aside from being a Technology Leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant, we also adamantly promote an internal culture that truly embraces diversity, inclusion and equality in the workplace.
   

  

 Extreme Systems Engineer provides technology and product consulting, technical sales support for various account opportunities, performs high-level and in-depth technical presentations for customers, prospects, and Extreme channel partners in the territory of responsibility.
   

  

 Extreme Systems Engineer also provides support for RFI/RFP responses, organizes and leads Proof of Concept activities, designs solutions meeting customer requirements.
   

  

 Systems Engineer is also required to participate with assigned virtual teams and contribute to other team activities.
   

  

 Domestic/International travel will be required.
   

  

**Candidate Requirements**
* Excellent presentation skills (fluent in Swedish and English)
* Strong, successful pre-sales engineering track record in the industry and territory in a similar position is necessary
* A sound knowledge of fundamental networking technologies:
* Layer 2/3 switching
* IPv4/v6 routing concepts
* Overlay networking, VPNs
* Wi-Fi operation and design
* Network security principles
* Knowledge and practical experience in these areas are an advantage:
* Cloud technologies and Cloud-based network management platforms
* Compute and network virtualization principles
* Network management and orchestration software
* SD-WAN
* Automation scripting and APIs
* Ability to work as a part of customer project teams on design and PoC labs, setting criteria for successful PoCs, and overall solution designs
* Tenacity and perseverance (customer advocate facing internally to Extreme)
* Ability to build, develop, and maintain a network of people at the customer/partner side independent of sales being accepted as the trusted advisor
* When growing the business the willingness to assume a team-lead role for the account team when/if business requires additional resources.
* Experience working with partners is a plus for technical training on products.
* Major account experience and experience in closing deals is necessary.
* Extreme Networks certifications are desirable, but not mandatory
* Recognized industry certifications is a plus
* Ability to demonstrate knowledge and understanding of future trends and market directions
* Ability to support customer evaluations, demonstrations and detailed design requirements
* Good general hands-on lab experience is required


**About Extreme Networks**
 Extreme Networks is a global leader in cloud-managed networking solutions. We're committed to simplifying and securing the access network for organizations of all sizes. Our innovative technology and customer-centric approach have made us a trusted partner for 30,000+ customers worldwide.
   

  

 By harnessing the power of cloud computing, machine learning, and artificial intelligence, Extreme offers unparalleled simplicity and security for access networks. Our Cloud-Managed Wireless, Switching, Routing, and Security technologies provide unrivalled flexibility in deployment, management, and licensing. Working with pioneering Controller-less Wi-Fi and Cloud Management, Extreme delivers continuous innovation at Cloud-speed that constantly challenges the industry norm, allowing customers to rethink what’s possible.

title: Domänarkitekt (Lösningsarkitekt)
description:
Välkommen till Skandia och möjligheten att axla en spännande roll som Domänarkitekt. Här kan din insats göra verklig skillnad. Det kräver förstås ditt engagemang och din vilja att utveckla dig själv, kollegorna och affären.
   

  

 Som Domänarkitekt hos oss blir du en nyckelspelare i att driva framgångsrika lösningar som skapar långsiktigt värde för våra kunder och verksamheten. Hos oss blandas lång erfarenhet med nya tankar och idéer – vi vill framåt och strävar efter att ligga i framkant.
   

  

 Nu ser vi fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

**Domänarkitekt (Lösningsarkitekt) | Skandia | Stockholm**
 Som Domänarkitekt på Skandiabanken arbetar du utifrån det agila ramverket SAFe. Du ingår i en tågledning och ser till att vår arkitekturella "run way" är uppdaterad och relevant. Du driver arkitekturella mönster och stöttar våra agila team. Du har dagliga kontakter utanför tåget, till exempel med affärsenheten, kundenheten och andra tåg, för att påverka och synkronisera planer och förflyttningar tillsammans.
   

  

 Du ansvarar för att hålla den röda tråden i förflyttningarna vi gör, vilket innebär att rita upp målbildsarkitekturer och samtidigt balansera mot det vi har idag. Du bryter ner stora initiativ i mindre delar som var och en för sig kan leverera kundvärde så fort som möjligt. Rollen innebär också en nära relation med affären och att vara delaktig i affärsplaneringen på en strategisk nivå för att vägleda och driva större initiativ och planer över längre tid. Vidare planerar och realiserar du IT-lösningar baserat på verksamhetens behov och med förutsättningar från existerande IT-tjänster i organisationen.
   

  

 Du känner dig trygg med att kommunicera med såväl agila team som med bankledning och styrelse. I rollen som Domänarkitekt inom Banktåget är det värdefullt att du har en bred erfarenhet av IT-lösningar och förstår vikten av taktiska förflyttningar. Du arbetar flexibelt med stort fokus på leverans. Din djupa affärsförståelse gör att du kan översätta tekniska möjligheter till affärsnytta. Du är van att kommunicera visioner och vägen dit, vilket kräver goda kommunikationskunskaper. En stor del av arbetet innebär att presentera och förklara teknikens och affärsvalens innebörd för såväl verksamheten som andra arkitekter, IT- och verksamhetschefer samt ledningen.
   

  

 ,
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen har du;
   

  

* Naturligt intresse både för teknik och människor
* Meriterande med erfarenhet från Bank och- eller Finans
* Bred erfarenhet som lösnings/IT-arkitekt
* Förmåga att coacha och inspirera kollegor genom att stötta och hjälpa dem på deras resa
* Prestigelöst förhållningssätt, samtidigt som du står på dig och ser till att dina idéer blir till verklighet
* Optimistisk och lösningsorienterad inställning, med förmåga att se möjligheter i förändring
* Du har arbetat i lean-agila miljöer
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift


 Placeringsort är Stockholm med start enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

 Vi arbetar med löpande urval så du är välkommen med din ansökan så snart som möjligt.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan !

title: Virtual Account Executive-Sweden
description:
**Extreme Networks Named to Computerworld’s 2023 List of Best Places to Work in IT!**
 Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions and rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before and with double digit growth year over year, no provider is better positioned to deliver better outcomes on scale, than Extreme.
   

  

 We believe in “walking the walk” of our strong core values which enable us to successfully advance together. Diversity and Inclusion is a vital part of our values and beliefs, and we’re proud to foster an environment where every Extreme employee can thrive.
   

  

 Come become part of something big with us! We are a global leader, with hubs in Europe, North America, South America, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East.
   

  

 Virtual Account Executive is sales professional focused on acquiring and developing business within assigned territories and verticals, while looking for new logo prospects and developing existing accounts. Candidates will effectively be spending 70% of the time on active selling and 30% on supporting tasks such as network quotes, agreeing conditions with partners and other tasks related to sales.
   

  

**Virtual Sales Tasks**
* Acquire new logo business, build strong pipeline.
* Actively seeks out and develops new customers, new opportunities.
* Proactively contacting the existing clients to maximize business potential – active upsell/cross sell .
* Engaging with new leads provided by Operations Team, maximize MQL conversion into real opportunity
* Generate new sales leads and opportunities
* Acquisition and developing own customer portfolio – direct touch with end users is requirement
* Provide consistent interaction with existing customers – upsell/cross sell initiatives
* Ensures that information about new products, services, and operational changes are communicated to customers on a timely basis
* Maintain and builds account relationships.
* Represents the Company at industry trade shows and conferences – travel requirements is a must


**Other Tasks**
* Manage the day to day client meetings.
* Maintains all information about customers, including all contact information and call reports, accurately and timely in CRM (Salesforce).
* Managing the jobs from quotation stage to booking in line with the client expectations and communicating effectively any service issues.
* Manage and follow-up on quotes.
* Internal liaison with the operations team assisting with quotations and service information.
* Reporting activities to the country manager
* Strong Swedish language skills

title: Experienced professionals to our SAP Finance team (Stockholm)
description:
Deloitte is a leading global provider of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, and Consultative Services. With more than 457,000 professionals in over 150 countries, we help our clients and society to solve complex problems and achieve ambitious goals. We are driven by one purpose: to make an impact that matters. To us, this means lasting results for our clients and their businesses, ideas and actions that contribute to a greater good. It also means empowering our people and supporting them in their growth journey.
   

  




**Job Description**

 Deloitte is looking for talented and experienced professionals to join our SAP-team in Sweden. As a market leader, we work with both global and local organizations on complex transformations, including major business-driven IT changes. With approximately 25,000 SAP experts in over 135 countries, Deloitte is among SAP’s most valued strategic partners. This is why SAP has placed Deloitte within the highest strategic alliance partner category, and why we have been recognized as the Global Leader in SAP Services by leading consultancies and analysts such as Forrester and Gartner.
   

  





 We are looking for
 **senior SAP Finance professionals** 
 who have an appetite for delivering sustainable, business-driven projects and being excited to co-operate with the largest companies and well-known brands. You enjoy engaging with clients to understand their requirements and find solution options for key challenges in finance area providing subject matter expertise with a good awareness of SAP and associated technologies within the process area.
   

  




**Qualifications**

 Your most important attributes we’d like to see are:
   

  




* Thorough expertise in finance related SAP S/4HANA areas/competences such as Central Finance, FI/CO, Margin & Profitability Analysis, Project accounting with PS, Product Costing, Master Data modelling, Understanding of end to end process like Order to Cash, Procure to Pay or other
* Good understanding of SAP S/4HANA product roadmap (experience of other related SAP solutions such as e.g. Group Reporting, SAC is advantageous but not required) and knowledge of relevant delivery methods for SAP (waterfall, hybrid agile, agile) preferably with deployment experience e.g. global template rollouts
* Great addition (but not must) if the candidate has a high level understanding of the SAP cloud offerings -RISE and GROW


 Additionally, to ensure smooth start and succeeding in the role, it is required from the applicant to:
   

  

* Hold a master’s degree or similar relevant educational background with years of relevant SAP experience - preferably across multiple industries. Broad SAP functional and technical expertise in your own process area with a good understanding of integrations between SAP modules and other applications
* Have previous consulting, project delivery and sales/pre-sales experience working with multiple large clients both with business and IT stakeholders
* Be fluent in both written and spoken English with excellent communication and presentation skills, and an ability to conceptualize and communicate complex topics in a clear and understandable manner. Proficiency in Swedish language seen as an advantage but is not required.


**Additional Information**

**We offer**




 At Deloitte, we are committed to helping our employees grow and develop throughout their career. We offer a range of on-the-job learning experiences, formal development programs at Deloitte University, and access to a personal coach to support you in identifying and utilizing your strengths. We also provide the necessary training and resources for you to obtain various certifications to further advance in your career.
   

  

 Our culture is built on collaboration and innovation. We value diverse perspectives and encourage our employees to think creatively to find the best solutions for our clients. We work hand-in-hand with our clients to understand their unique needs and to develop tailored solutions that drive growth and innovation. At Deloitte, you´ll have the chance to grow and succeed alongside like-minded professionals who share your passion.
   

  

**How to apply**




 Your application should consist of a CV and a cover letter and you apply directly online. Please apply as soon as possible as we will review applications and interview candidates on an ongoing basis.
   

  

*As a qualitative part of Deloitte's recruitment process, our final candidates undergo a background check, to increase awareness of our future employees, secure the working environment for our employees and meet regulatory requirements. The background check process is carried out in collaboration with To Find Out.* 
*https://tofindout.se/en/background-check/* 
  

  

**Questions?**




 For questions regarding the application process or the role, please contact Rasmus Öhman, rohman@deloitte.se.
   

  

**We are looking forward to your application!** 
  

  

 For further information on Deloitte, please visit
 
 www.deloitte.se
   

  






**What impact will you make?**




 Every day, your work will make an impact that matters, while you thrive in a dynamic culture of inclusion, collaboration and high performance. We do not just aspire to make solutions. We wish to create an impact that makes a positive and crucial difference for the people around us, our clients and our society. Deloitte is where you’ll find unlimited opportunities to succeed and realize your full potential.

title: Senior Commercial Account Executive - Nordics
company_industry: Software Development and Computer and Network Security
description:
Fastly helps people stay better connected with the things they love. Fastly’s edge cloud platform enables customers to create great digital experiences quickly, securely, and reliably by processing, serving, and securing our customers’ applications as close to their end-users as possible — at the edge of the Internet. The platform is designed to take advantage of the modern internet, to be programmable, and to support agile software development. Fastly’s customers include many of the world’s most prominent companies, including Vimeo, Pinterest, The New York Times, and GitHub.
 



  





 We're building a more trustworthy Internet. Come join us.
 



  





***Senior Commercial Account Executive - Nordics***




 As part of Fastly’s UK, Central Europe & Nordics Sales team, you will be in charge of identifying, working and closing opportunities in high-growth mid market/ commercial accounts across the Nordics regions. You will drive proactive outbound sales opportunities and respond to inbound demand, to work those opportunities from initial qualification to close.
 



  





 You will execute on the account plan to deliver maximum new business bookings and revenue while managing complete and complex sales-cycles, often presenting to partners the value of our platform. You will structure and execute daily, weekly and monthly plans to improve prospecting, meetings, presenting follow-up calls, including preparing for calls by using Sales Engineer resources, and debriefing the team on the outcome and next steps.
 



  





**What You'll Do** 



* Prospecting to generate pipeline across the region
* Accountable for driving new business acquisition, revenue growth and meeting or exceeding quota goals and targets
* Effectively and independently deliver the Fastly company story, value proposition, and product demonstrations
* Develop and execute a comprehensive sales and account plan, with the support of the team lead, to drive customer acquisition
* Prepare and manage proposals and quotes, plus ensure the closing of deals and contracts
* Ensure account management for closed accounts to seek additional revenue opportunities
* Accelerate customer adoption and ensure customer satisfaction
* Managing all aspects of the sales cycle including: prospecting, sales campaign/meetings, negotiation close, account management
* Provide accurate forecasting
* Ensure you identify the decision-makers, stakeholders and users of services related to Fastly in order to prospect, sell and ensure the sales cycle is driven to deliver the greatest success
* Develop and maintain daily and weekly plans to maximize prospecting via phone, email and other means, plus planning your time for prospect follow up, customer engagement etc
* Work with Sales Engineering, Marketing, and/or Customer Development to ensure aligned plans to enable success against goals and objectives



  





**What We're Looking For** 



* Industry Experience in Security, CDN, Cloud Networking Services or Edge Computing
* Ideally 5+ years of technology related sales or business development experience with senior leadership and C-level executives
* Direct field experience in selling within mid-market sector in the region
* Technical knowledge of content delivery network services, web analytics, cyber security, website performance, cloud storage OR managed web hosting is required
* Exposure to the Tech start-up/ scale up ecosystem in the region
* Proven track record of prospecting, managing and close sales, manage accurate pipeline and forecast
* Independent, self-disciplined and possess strong verbal and written communications skills
* Curiosity and a desire to understand a customer’s industry/business and meet their unarticulated and unmet needs
* Demonstrates an insatiable appetite to learn and improve
* Problem-solver
* Eagerness to work hard, exceed expectations and outperform quotas
* Fluency in Swedish and English is essential



  





**Work Hours** 



* This position will require you to be available during core business hours.



  





**Work Location & Travel Requirements:** 




 This position is a remote position. Applicants should be based in the Greater Stockholm area, Sweden.
 



 This position will require travel to the US and across Europe, as required by your role or requested by your manager.
 



  





**Benefits** 




 We care about you. Fastly works hard to create a positive environment for our employees, and we think your life outside of work is important too. We support our teams with great benefits that start on the first day of your employment with Fastly. Curious about our offerings?
 



 We offer a comprehensive benefits package designed to meet your needs. Our offerings may vary depending on the country where you work and are subject to change.
 



  





**Why Fastly?** 



* We have a huge impact. Fastly is a small company with a big reach. Not only do our customers have a tremendous user base, but we also support a growing number of open source projects and initiatives. Outside of code, employees are encouraged to share causes close to their heart with others so we can help lend a supportive hand.
* We love distributed teams. Fastly’s home-base is in San Francisco, but we have multiple offices and employees sprinkled around the globe. As a new hire, you will be able to attend our IN-PERSON new hire orientation in our San Francisco office! It is an exciting week-long experience that we offer to new employees to build connections with colleagues across Fastly, participate in hands-on learning opportunities, and immerse yourself in our culture firsthand.
* We value diversity. Growing and maintaining our inclusive and diverse team matters to us. We are committed to being a company where our employees feel comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work and have the ability to be successful -- every day.
* We are passionate. Fastly is chock full of passionate people and we’re not ‘one size fits all’. Fastly employs authors, pilots, skiers, parents (of humans and animals), makeup geeks, coffee connoisseurs, and more. We love employees for who they are and what they are passionate about.



  





**We’re always looking for humble, sharp, and creative folks to join the Fastly team. If you think you might be a fit please apply! A fully completed application and resume or CV are required when applying.** 




  





*Fastly is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunity and to providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. Our employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, family or parental status, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.* 




*Consistent with the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) and federal or state disability laws, Fastly will provide reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If reasonable accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact your Recruiter, or the Fastly Employee Relations team at candidateaccommodations@fastly.com or 501-287-4901.* 




*Fastly collects and processes personal data submitted by job applicants in accordance with our Privacy Policy. Please see our privacy notice for job applicants.*

title: Network Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
**The** 
**Role: Network Engineer**
**The Team:** 
 The OSTTRA Technology team is composed of Capital Markets Technology professionals, who build, support and protect the applications that operate our network. The technology landscape includes high-performance, high-volume applications as well as compute-intensive applications, leveraging contemporary microservices, cloud-based architectures
   

  

**The** 
**Impact:** 
 Together, we build, support, protect and manage high-performance, resilient platforms that process more than 100 million messages a day. Our services are vital to automated trade processing around the globe, managing peak volumes and working with our customers and regulators to ensure the efficient settlement of trades and effective operation of global capital markets
   

  

**What’s in it for you:** 
 We are looking for highly motivated technology professionals who will strengthen our specialisms, and champion our uniqueness to create a company that is collaborative, respectful, and inclusive to all. This is an excellent opportunity to be part of a team based out of Stockholm and to work with colleagues across multiple regions globally.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* As a network engineer you will be a member of OSTTRAs global network infrastructure team that is responsible for the operations of our office, data centre and cloud network infrastructure.
* You will be involved in all aspects of our network infrastructure lifecycles and work with design, implementation and maintaining our network.


**What We’re Looking For**
* A degree in Computer Science or a related subject or the equivalent in knowledge and work experience
* A minimum of 5 years of experience with network operations and architecture
* Experience with network security, firewalls, VPNs and IDS/IPS solutions
* Experience in protocols such as BGP and MPLS
* Experience from working with Juniper, Palo Alto Networks, F5
* Self-motivated and great under pressure.
* Big-picture understanding of the networking concepts behind virtual environments and various hybrid cloud initiatives
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Experience in configuration management and change management
* Experience with working with data centres in Sweden, US & UK


**A Plus If You Have Experience In**
* Working experience from the financial industry
* Hands-on experience of Linux operating systems
* Experience using network automation tools such as Terraform, Ansible, Git and Python. Excellent AWS Troubleshooting
* Experience in various AWS network such as EC2, TGW, ALB, VGW, VPC, Direct-Connect, ELB, Cloud-formation


**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries

 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
